<body lang=EN-US link="#6633CC" vlink=purple style='tab-interval:.5in'>

<div class=Section1>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><span style='font-size:28.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:
Arial'>Problem E</span></b><span style='font-family:Arial'><br>
</span><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style='font-size:20.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:24.0pt;font-family:Arial'>Encoding/Decoding</span></b><span
style='font-family:Arial'><br>
<b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>Input: </b><span style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
bold'>Standard Input<o:p></o:p></span></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><span style='font-family:Arial'>Output: </span></b><span
style='font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'>Standard Output<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><i><span style='mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;color:windowtext'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></i></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'>A good encoding program has the
following properties.</p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'>-it has some different symbols.</p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'>-Each of these different symbols is
encoded into different strings which contains digits from 0 to k-1. Like for 3
different symbol and k = 2 corresponding encoding code can be 0<span
class=GramE>,10,11</span>.</p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'>-You can encode a string
containing this different symbol by just concatenating their corresponding
encoding code. Like from the previous example the encoding of the string <span
class=SpellE>babc</span> is 1001011. </p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'>-You select the encoding of these
symbols in such a way that you can decode the encoded string without any
ambiguity. Means if you build a prefix tree with these encoding code then each
of the node will have either k child or none. Huffman tree is a good example
with similar tree k=2.</p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'>Now you have a set of <span
class=SpellE>n+m</span> different symbol. But you have lost the encoding string
of m of those. Given the encoding code of the rest of the n symbols you have
determine how many ways you can select the encoding set of the lost m symbols.</p>

<p class=MsoNormal><i><span style='mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;color:windowtext'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></i></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span
style='font-size:16.0pt;font-family:Arial'>Input<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'>First line contains <span
class=GramE>T(</span>1&#8804;T&#8804;100) the number of test cases. Then T test
cases follow.</p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'>First line of each test case
contain 3 integer <span class=GramE>n(</span>0&#8804;n&#8804;1000),m(1&#8804;m&#8804;200)
and k(2&#8804;k&#8804;5). Each of the next n line contains a string containing
digits from 0 to k-1. This is encoding code for a symbol. These n codes are
valid. Means none of <span class=GramE>these n string</span> will not be prefix
of one another.</p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><span style='font-size:16.0pt;font-family:Arial'>Output</span></b><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style='font-size:16.0pt'><o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'>For each test case find the
number of way you can select the other m encoding string set. The number of way
may be huge. Output the result%10007.</p>

<p class=MsoNormal><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p>

<h1 align=left style='text-align:left'><b><span style='font-size:16.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;font-style:normal'>Sample
Input<span style='mso-spacerun:yes'>                             </span>Output
for Sample Input<o:p></o:p></span></b></h1>

<table class=MsoNormalTable border=1 cellspacing=0 cellpadding=0
 style='background:#CCCCCC;border-collapse:collapse;border:none;mso-border-alt:
 solid windowtext .5pt;mso-padding-alt:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
 <tr style='mso-yfti-irow:0;mso-yfti-firstrow:yes;mso-yfti-lastrow:yes'>
  <td width=307 valign=top style='width:3.2in;border:solid windowtext 1.0pt;
  mso-border-alt:solid windowtext .5pt;padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal><span style='font-size:11.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>5<o:p></o:p></span></p>
  <p class=MsoNormal><span style='font-size:11.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>0
  5 2<o:p></o:p></span></p>
  <p class=MsoNormal><span style='font-size:11.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>0
  5 3<o:p></o:p></span></p>
  <p class=MsoNormal><span style='font-size:11.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>1
  5 2<o:p></o:p></span></p>
  <p class=MsoNormal><span style='font-size:11.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>000<o:p></o:p></span></p>
  <p class=MsoNormal><span style='font-size:11.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>2
  4 2<o:p></o:p></span></p>
  <p class=MsoNormal><span style='font-size:11.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>01<o:p></o:p></span></p>
  <p class=MsoNormal><span style='font-size:11.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>10<o:p></o:p></span></p>
  <p class=MsoNormal><span style='font-size:11.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>3
  20 3<o:p></o:p></span></p>
  <p class=MsoNormal><span style='font-size:11.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>012<o:p></o:p></span></p>
  <p class=MsoNormal><span style='font-size:11.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>120<o:p></o:p></span></p>
  <p class=MsoNormal><span style='font-size:11.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>201<o:p></o:p></span></p>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='mso-layout-grid-align:none;text-autospace:none'><b><span
  style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width=309 valign=top style='width:231.85pt;border:solid windowtext 1.0pt;
  border-left:none;mso-border-left-alt:solid windowtext .5pt;mso-border-alt:
  solid windowtext .5pt;padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal><span style='font-size:11.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>14<o:p></o:p></span></p>
  <p class=MsoNormal><span style='font-size:11.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>3<o:p></o:p></span></p>
  <p class=MsoNormal><span style='font-size:11.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>9<o:p></o:p></span></p>
  <p class=MsoNormal><span style='font-size:11.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>5<o:p></o:p></span></p>
  <p class=MsoNormal><span style='font-size:11.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>5313<o:p></o:p></span></p>
  <p class=MsoNormal><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span
  style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></b></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
</table>

<div class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center;tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'>

<hr size=2 width="100%" align=center>

</div>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><span
class=SpellE><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style='font-family:
Arial'>Problemsetter</span></b></span><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span
style='font-family:Arial'>: Abdullah al <span class=SpellE>Mahmud</span> (<span
class=SpellE>Satej</span>)<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style='font-family:Arial'>Special
Thanks: <span class=SpellE>Manzurur</span> <span class=SpellE>Rahman</span>
Khan<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p>

</div>

<title>Problem F - Linear Diophantine Tidbits</title>

<body lang=EN-US link="#6633CC" vlink=purple style='tab-interval:.5in'>

<div class=Section1>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><span style='font-size:28.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:
Arial'>Problem F</span></b><span style='font-family:Arial'><br>
</span><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style='font-size:20.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:24.0pt;font-family:Arial'>Linear Diophantine Tidbits </span></b><span
style='font-family:Arial'><br>
<b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>Input: </b><span style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
bold'>Standard Input<o:p></o:p></span></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><span style='font-family:Arial'>Output: </span></b><span
style='font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'>Standard Output <o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'>&nbsp;</p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'>Solving linear Diophantine equations
with three variables is not the easiest thing in the world and in this problem
you will have to do something similar to that. In this problem we will deal
with a specific Diophantine equation 1073x + 1827y + 3108z = 270396. Of course
this equation has infinite number of all integer (The values of x, y and z are
all integers) solutions, so it is pointless to ask the number of solutions. So
you will have to find special type of all integer solutions. </p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><!--[if gte vml 1]><v:shapetype
 id="_x0000_t75" coordsize="21600,21600" o:spt="75" o:preferrelative="t"
 path="m@4@5l@4@11@9@11@9@5xe" filled="f" stroked="f">
 <v:stroke joinstyle="miter"/>
 <v:formulas>
  <v:f eqn="if lineDrawn pixelLineWidth 0"/>
  <v:f eqn="sum @0 1 0"/>
  <v:f eqn="sum 0 0 @1"/>
  <v:f eqn="prod @2 1 2"/>
  <v:f eqn="prod @3 21600 pixelWidth"/>
  <v:f eqn="prod @3 21600 pixelHeight"/>
  <v:f eqn="sum @0 0 1"/>
  <v:f eqn="prod @6 1 2"/>
  <v:f eqn="prod @7 21600 pixelWidth"/>
  <v:f eqn="sum @8 21600 0"/>
  <v:f eqn="prod @7 21600 pixelHeight"/>
  <v:f eqn="sum @10 21600 0"/>
 </v:formulas>
 <v:path o:extrusionok="f" gradientshapeok="t" o:connecttype="rect"/>
 <o:lock v:ext="edit" aspectratio="t"/>
</v:shapetype><v:shape id="_x0000_s1040" type="#_x0000_t75" style='position:absolute;
 left:0;text-align:left;margin-left:0;margin-top:3.15pt;width:198.45pt;
 height:132.1pt;z-index:1;mso-position-horizontal:left'>
 <v:imagedata src="http://uva.onlinejudge.org/external/114/f_files/image001.png"  o:title=" />
 <w:wrap type="square"/>
</v:shape><![endif]--><![if !vml]><img width=265 height=176
src="http://uva.onlinejudge.org/external/114/f_files/image001.png"  align=left hspace=12 v:shapes="_x0000_s1040"><![endif]>You
will be given three different possible all integer solution triples of this
equation. Many other solutions can be found by taking weighted average of any
two of these integer solutions (Not necessarily these newly found solutions are
integer solutions). And these new solutions can be used with the given three
solutions to find many other solutions by taking weighted average of any two.
Your job is to find the total number of all integer solution triples obtainable
in this way.</p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'>For example suppose the given
three possible solutions are (r1<sub><span style='mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt'>x</span></sub>,
r1<sub><span style='mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt'>y</span></sub>, r1<sub><span
style='mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt'>z</span></sub>), (r2<sub><span
style='mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt'>x</span></sub>, r2<sub><span
style='mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt'>y</span></sub>, r2<sub><span
style='mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt'>z</span></sub>) and (r3<sub><span
style='mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt'>x</span></sub>, r3<sub><span
style='mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt'>y</span></sub>, r3<sub><span
style='mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt'>z</span></sub>). A new solution (<span
class=SpellE><span class=GramE>r<sub><span style='mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt'>x</span></sub></span></span>,
<span class=SpellE>r<sub><span style='mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt'>y</span></sub></span>,
<span class=SpellE>r<sub><span style='mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt'>z</span></sub></span>)
can be found by taking the weighted average of first two of these two
solutions. That <span class=GramE>is </span><sub><!--[if gte vml 1]><v:shape
 id="_x0000_i1025" type="#_x0000_t75" style='width:84.75pt;height:30.75pt'
 o:ole=" >
 <v:imagedata src="http://uva.onlinejudge.org/external/114/f_files/image001.png"  o:title=" />
</v:shape><![endif]--><![if !vml]><img width=113 height=41
src="http://uva.onlinejudge.org/external/114/f_files/image001.png"  v:shapes="_x0000_i1025"><![endif]></sub><!--[if gte mso 9]><xml>
 <o:OLEObject Type="Embed" ProgID="Equation.3" ShapeID="_x0000_i1025"
  DrawAspect="Content" ObjectID="_1268158981">
 </o:OLEObject>
</xml><![endif]-->, <sub><!--[if gte vml 1]><v:shape id="_x0000_i1026" type="#_x0000_t75"
 style='width:86.25pt;height:33pt' o:ole=" >
 <v:imagedata src="http://uva.onlinejudge.org/external/114/f_files/image001.png"  o:title=" />
</v:shape><![endif]--><![if !vml]><img width=115 height=44
src="http://uva.onlinejudge.org/external/114/f_files/image001.png"  v:shapes="_x0000_i1026"><![endif]></sub><!--[if gte mso 9]><xml>
 <o:OLEObject Type="Embed" ProgID="Equation.3" ShapeID="_x0000_i1026"
  DrawAspect="Content" ObjectID="_1268158982">
 </o:OLEObject>
</xml><![endif]-->, <sub><!--[if gte vml 1]><v:shape id="_x0000_i1027" type="#_x0000_t75"
 style='width:84pt;height:30.75pt' o:ole=" >
 <v:imagedata src="http://uva.onlinejudge.org/external/114/f_files/image001.png"  o:title=" />
</v:shape><![endif]--><![if !vml]><img width=112 height=41
src="http://uva.onlinejudge.org/external/114/f_files/image001.png"  v:shapes="_x0000_i1027"><![endif]></sub><!--[if gte mso 9]><xml>
 <o:OLEObject Type="Embed" ProgID="Equation.3" ShapeID="_x0000_i1027"
  DrawAspect="Content" ObjectID="_1268158983">
 </o:OLEObject>
</xml><![endif]-->. Here (w&#8805;0, v&#8805;0 and (w+v)&gt;0). Of course for
different values of w and v many solutions can be found and may be only a few
of them are all integer solutions. All the new found solutions along with the
given three solutions can be used to find infinite number of solutions by
taking the weighed average of any two. Although such solutions are infinite in
number, there are only a finite number of all integer solutions found in this
way. You are to find the total number of different all integer solutions
(triples) found. </p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p>

<h5 style='text-align:justify'><span class=StyleArial16pt><span
style='font-size:16.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>Input</span></span><span
class=StyleArial16pt><span style='mso-ansi-font-size:12.0pt;font-family:"Times New Roman";
mso-fareast-font-family:"Arial Unicode MS"'><o:p></o:p></span></span></h5>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'>The first line of the input file
contains an integer N (0&lt;N&lt;16001) which denotes the total number of input
sets. Each of the next N lines contains nine integers r1<sub><span
style='mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt'>x</span></sub>, r1<sub><span
style='mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt'>y</span></sub>, r1<sub><span
style='mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt'>z</span></sub><span class=GramE>,<span
style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>r2<sub><span style='mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt'>x</span></sub></span>,
r2<sub><span style='mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt'>y</span></sub>, r2<sub><span
style='mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt'>z</span></sub>, r3<sub><span
style='mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt'>x</span></sub>, r3<sub><span
style='mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt'>y</span></sub>, r3<sub><span
style='mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt'>z</span></sub>. These nine integers mean that
(r1<sub><span style='mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt'>x</span></sub>, r1<sub><span
style='mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt'>y</span></sub>, r1<sub><span
style='mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt'>z</span></sub>), (r2<sub><span
style='mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt'>x</span></sub>, r2<sub><span
style='mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt'>y</span></sub>, r2<sub><span
style='mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt'>z</span></sub>) and (r3<sub><span
style='mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt'>x</span></sub>, r3<sub><span
style='mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt'>y</span></sub>, r3<sub><span
style='mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt'>z</span></sub>) are three possible all
integer solutions of the Diophantine equation 1073x + 1827y + 3108z =
270396.<span style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p>

<h4><span class=StyleArial16pt><span style='font-size:16.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:
10.0pt;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>Output </span></span><span
class=StyleArial16pt><span style='mso-ansi-font-size:12.0pt;font-family:"Times New Roman"'><o:p></o:p></span></span></h4>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;tab-stops:143.25pt'>For each set
of input produce one line of output. This line contains an integer T which
denotes the total number of all integer solutions that can be obtained by
taking weighted average of the given three all integer solutions and the
subsequent solutions (not necessarily all integer). </p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;tab-stops:143.25pt'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p>

<h1 align=left style='text-align:left'><b><span style='font-size:16.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;font-style:normal'>Sample
Input<span style='mso-spacerun:yes'>                                    
</span>Output for Sample Input<o:p></o:p></span></b></h1>

<table class=MsoNormalTable border=1 cellspacing=0 cellpadding=0
 style='background:#CCCCCC;border-collapse:collapse;border:none;mso-border-alt:
 solid windowtext .5pt;mso-padding-alt:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
 <tr style='mso-yfti-irow:0;mso-yfti-firstrow:yes;mso-yfti-lastrow:yes'>
  <td width=355 valign=top style='width:3.7in;border:solid windowtext 1.0pt;
  mso-border-alt:solid windowtext .5pt;padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='mso-layout-grid-align:none;text-autospace:none'><b><span
  style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>3<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='mso-layout-grid-align:none;text-autospace:none'><b><span
  style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>168
  -296 203 315 -925 522 42 -814 551<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='mso-layout-grid-align:none;text-autospace:none'><b><span
  style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>-840
  740 -58 441 37 -87 -189 111 87<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='mso-layout-grid-align:none;text-autospace:none'><b><span
  style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>987
  851 -754 756 -592 174 -63 -555 435<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width=261 valign=top style='width:195.85pt;border:solid windowtext 1.0pt;
  border-left:none;mso-border-left-alt:solid windowtext .5pt;mso-border-alt:
  solid windowtext .5pt;padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span
  style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>28<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>
  <p class=MsoNormal><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span
  style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>59<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>
  <p class=MsoNormal><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span

  </td>

<div class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center;tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'>

</div>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><span
class=SpellE><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style='font-family:
Arial'>Problemsetter</span></b></span><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span
style='font-family:Arial'>: <span class=SpellE>Shahriar</span> Manzoor<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style='font-family:Arial'>Special

<!--[if gte mso 10]>
<style>

	mso-fareast-language:#0400;
	mso-bidi-language:#0400;}

<![endif]--><!--[if gte mso 9]><xml>
 <o:shapedefaults v:ext="edit" spidmax="2050"/>

  <o:idmap v:ext="edit" data="1"/>
 </o:shapelayout></xml><![endif]-->
</head>

<body lang=EN-US style='tab-interval:.5in'>

<div class=Section1>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><span style='font-size:28.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;font-family:
Arial'>Problem G</span></b><span style='font-family:Arial'><br>
</span><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style='font-size:20.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:24.0pt;font-family:Arial'>Tree in a Grid<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><span style='font-family:Arial'>Input: </span></b><span
style='font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'>Standard Input</span><span
style='mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;color:black;mso-bidi-font-weight:
bold'><o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><span style='font-family:Arial'>Output: </span></b><span
style='font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'>Standard Output </span><span
style='mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;color:black;mso-bidi-font-weight:
bold'><o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'>&nbsp;</p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'>You are given a grid of row r and
column c. The rows are numbered from 0 to r-1 and columns are numbered from 0
to c-1. A node in row <span class=SpellE>i</span> and column j can have edge with
nodes at position (i-1,j),(i,j-1),(i+1,j) and (i,j+1).<span
style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>Now for the given grid some of its edge is
given. You can add some other edge in the grid. You have to add the edges in
such a way so that all the nodes in the grid are connected but do not create
any cycle. You have to count the number of ways that you can add edges in the
grid.</p>

<p class=MsoNormal><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p>

<h5 style='tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><span
class=StyleArial16pt><span style='font-size:16.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt'>Input</span></span><span
class=StyleArial16pt><span style='font-size:16.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;
mso-fareast-font-family:"Arial Unicode MS"'><o:p></o:p></span></span></h5>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'>First line contains <span
class=GramE>T(</span>1&#8804;T&#8804;30) the number of test cases. Then T test
cases follow.</p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'>First line of each test case
contain 3 integer <span class=GramE>r(</span>1&#8804;r&#8804;200),c(1&#8804;c&#8804;8)
and<span style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span><span class=SpellE>md</span>(1&#8804;md&#8804;1000000).
Next 2*r-1 line contains the description of the maze. Each of these line
contains 2*c-1 character. Each of the even number column of the even number row
will be a . denoting the node. Each of the odd number column of the even
number row will either be a space denoting that there is no edge between the
adjacent vertices or a - character denoting there is an edge. Each of the
even number column of the odd number rows can be single | denoting there is a
vertical edge or a single space denoting there is no edge there. See the sample
input for further clarification. Note in the sample input the spaces are
replaced by S for readability. In the original input file they will be spaces.</p>

<h4><span class=StyleArial16pt><span style='font-size:10.0pt;mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></span></h4>

<h4><span class=StyleArial16pt><span style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>Output
</span></span><span class=StyleArial16pt><span style='font-size:12.0pt;
font-family:"Times New Roman";mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><o:p></o:p></span></span></h4>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'>For each test case output the
number of ways you can add edges to the grid so that the grid is connected and
form a tree. This result may be large. <span class=GramE>So output <span
class=SpellE>result%md</span>.</span> In the case the existing edges already
creates a cycle output <span class=GramE>A</span> line containing Impossible
without the quotes.</p>

<h1 style='tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><span
style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-weight:normal;
mso-bidi-font-style:italic'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></h1>

<h1 style='tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><span
style='font-size:16.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal;mso-bidi-font-style:italic'>Sample Input<span
style='mso-spacerun:yes'>                  </span><span
style='mso-spacerun:yes'>           </span>Output for Sample Input</span><span
style='font-size:16.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;font-family:Arial'><o:p></o:p></span></h1>

<table class=MsoNormalTable border=1 cellspacing=0 cellpadding=0
 style='background:#CCCCCC;border-collapse:collapse;border:none;mso-border-alt:
 solid windowtext .5pt;mso-padding-alt:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
 <tr style='mso-yfti-irow:0;mso-yfti-firstrow:yes;mso-yfti-lastrow:yes'>
  <td width=307 valign=top style='width:3.2in;border:solid windowtext 1.0pt;
  mso-border-alt:solid windowtext .5pt;padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal><span style='font-size:11.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>6<o:p></o:p></span></p>
  <p class=MsoNormal><span style='font-size:11.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>2
  <span class=SpellE>2</span> 1000<o:p></o:p></span></p>
  <p class=MsoNormal><span style='font-size:11.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>.S.<o:p></o:p></span></p>
  <p class=MsoNormal><span style='font-size:11.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>SSS<o:p></o:p></span></p>
  <p class=MsoNormal><span style='font-size:11.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>.S.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

  <p class=MsoNormal><span style='font-size:11.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>.S.<o:p></o:p></span></p>
  <p class=MsoNormal><span style='font-size:11.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>2
  <span class=SpellE>2</span> 100<o:p></o:p></span></p>

  solid windowtext .5pt;padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>

  style='font-size:11.0pt;font-family:"Courier New";color:black'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></b></p>
  </td>

 </o:shapelayout></xml><![endif]-->

<body lang=EN-US link="#6633CC" vlink=purple style='tab-interval:.5in'>

<div class=Section1>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><span style='font-size:28.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;font-family:
Arial'>Problem H</span></b><span style='font-family:Arial'><br>
</span><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style='font-size:20.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:24.0pt;font-family:Arial'>Sum</span></b><span
style='font-family:Arial'><br>
<b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>Input: </b><span style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
bold'>Standard Input<o:p></o:p></span></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><span style='font-family:Arial'>Output: </span></b><span
style='font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'>Standard Output <o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'>&nbsp;</p>

<p class=MsoNormal>You have a sequence of length n. The element of this
sequence is <span class=SpellE>seq</span>[<span class=SpellE>i</span>] (<span
class=SpellE>i</span> = 1 to n).</p>

<p class=MsoNormal>Now consider a function</p>

<p class=MsoNormal><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><span class=GramE>F(</span><span class=SpellE>k,a,b</span>)
=<span style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>&#8721;<span class=SpellE>seq</span>[<span
class=SpellE>i</span>]*(i-a+1)<sup>k</sup> for each <span class=SpellE>i</span>
between a to b inclusive.</p>

<p class=MsoNormal><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p>

<p class=MsoNormal>Given a sequence of length n you have to calculate <span
class=GramE>F(</span><span class=SpellE>k,a,b</span>).</p>

<p class=MsoNormal><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p>

<h5 style='text-align:justify'><span class=StyleArial16pt0><span
style='font-size:16.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>Input</span></span><span
class=StyleArial16pt0><span style='mso-ansi-font-size:12.0pt;font-family:"Times New Roman";
mso-fareast-font-family:"Arial Unicode MS"'><o:p></o:p></span></span></h5>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'>First line contains <span
class=GramE>T(</span>1&#8804;T&#8804;5) the number of test cases. Then T test
cases follow.</p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'>The first line of each test case
contains an integer n (1&#8804;n&#8804;100000).</p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'>The next line contains n integers
<span class=SpellE><span class=GramE>seq</span></span><span class=GramE>[</span>1]
to <span class=SpellE>seq</span>[n]. Each of these <span class=GramE>integer</span>
is in the range from 0 to 1000000000 inclusive.</p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'>Next line contains an integer q (q&lt;=10000)
the number of queries.</p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'>Each of the next q lines contains
3 integers <span class=SpellE>k<span class=GramE>,a,b</span></span>. k is
between 0 to 20 inclusive. 1&#8804;a&#8804;b&#8804;n.</p>

<p class=MsoNormal><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p>

<h4><span class=StyleArial16pt0><span style='font-size:16.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:
12.0pt;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>Output </span></span><span
class=StyleArial16pt0><span style='mso-ansi-font-size:12.0pt;font-family:"Times New Roman"'><o:p></o:p></span></span></h4>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'>For each of the query <span
class=SpellE>k<span class=GramE>,a,b</span></span> output contains 1 integer in
each line the value of F(<span class=SpellE>k,a,b</span>)mod 1000000009. </p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;tab-stops:143.25pt'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p>

<h1 align=left style='text-align:left'><b><span style='font-size:16.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;font-family:Arial;font-style:normal'>Sample
Input<span style='mso-spacerun:yes'>                              </span>Output
for Sample Input<o:p></o:p></span></b></h1>

<table class=MsoNormalTable border=1 cellspacing=0 cellpadding=0
 style='background:#CCCCCC;border-collapse:collapse;border:none;mso-border-alt:
 solid windowtext .5pt;mso-padding-alt:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
 <tr style='mso-yfti-irow:0;mso-yfti-firstrow:yes;mso-yfti-lastrow:yes'>
  <td width=313 valign=top style='width:234.9pt;border:solid windowtext 1.0pt;
  mso-border-alt:solid windowtext .5pt;padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal><span style='font-size:11.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>2<o:p></o:p></span></p>
  <p class=MsoNormal><span style='font-size:11.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>10<o:p></o:p></span></p>

	mso-hansi-font-family:Symbol;
	mso-bidi-font-family:StarSymbol;}
@list l0:level9
	{mso-level-number-format:bullet;
	mso-level-text:\F0B7;
	mso-level-tab-stop:318.15pt;
	mso-level-number-position:left;
	margin-left:318.15pt;
	text-indent:-14.15pt;
	mso-ansi-font-size:9.0pt;
	mso-bidi-font-size:9.0pt;
	mso-ascii-font-family:Symbol;
	mso-hansi-font-family:Symbol;
	mso-bidi-font-family:StarSymbol;}
ol
	{margin-bottom:0in;}
ul
	{margin-bottom:0in;}
-->
</style>
<!--[if gte mso 10]>
<style>
 /* Style Definitions */
 table.MsoNormalTable
	{mso-style-name:"Table Normal";
	mso-tstyle-rowband-size:0;
	mso-tstyle-colband-size:0;
	mso-style-noshow:yes;
	mso-style-parent:" ;
	mso-padding-alt:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt;
	mso-para-margin:0in;
	mso-para-margin-bottom:.0001pt;
	mso-pagination:widow-orphan;
	font-size:10.0pt;
	font-family:"Times New Roman";
	mso-ansi-language:#0400;
	mso-fareast-language:#0400;
	mso-bidi-language:#0400;}
</style>
<![endif]--><!--[if gte mso 9]><xml>
 <o:shapedefaults v:ext="edit" spidmax="16386"/>
</xml><![endif]--><!--[if gte mso 9]><xml>
 <o:shapelayout v:ext="edit">
  <o:idmap v:ext="edit" data="1"/>
 </o:shapelayout></xml><![endif]-->
</head>

<body lang=EN-US link="#009999" vlink=purple style='tab-interval:.5in'>

<div class=Section1>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><span style='font-size:28.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:
Arial'>Problem I</span></b><span style='font-family:Arial'><br>
</span><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style='font-size:20.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:24.0pt;font-family:Arial'>Water Tanks EXTREME </span></b><span
style='font-family:Arial'><br>
<b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>Input: </b>S<span style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
bold'>tandard Input<o:p></o:p></span></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><span style='font-family:Arial'>Output: </span></b><span
style='font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'>Standard Output <o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoBodyText><span lang=EN-GB><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoBodyText><span lang=EN-GB>The Aqua Container Management <span
class=GramE>company</span> manages water storage facilities. They are
considering a system of storing water in a series of connected vertical tanks.
Each tank has a horizontal cross-sectional area of one square meter, but the
tanks have different heights. The base of each tank is at ground level. Each
tank is connected by a pipe to the previous tank in the series and by another
pipe to the next tank in the series. The pipes connecting the tanks are level.
Tank 1 is open so that air and water can flow into it freely at the top. All the
other tanks are closed so that air and water can flow in and out only through
the connecting pipes. The connecting pipes are large enough that water and air
can flow through them freely and simultaneously but small enough that their
dimensions can be ignored in this problem.</span></p>

<p class=MsoBodyText><span lang=EN-GB>The series of tanks is filled by pouring
water slowly into the top of tank 1, continuing until the water level reaches
the top of tank 1. As the water level rises above the connecting pipes, water
flows among the tanks. </span></p>

<p class=MsoBodyText><span lang=EN-GB>Aqua Container Management needs a program
to compute the cubic meters of water that can be poured into the series of
tanks before the water level reaches the top of tank 1. </span></p>

<p class=MsoBodyText><span lang=EN-GB>The figure below illustrates a simple
case involving only two tanks. After the filling procedure is completed, the
air in the upper part of the second tank is compressed (its air pressure is
greater than one atmosphere), so the water level in the second tank is lower
than the water level in the first tank. </span></p>

<p class=MsoBodyText align=center style='text-align:center'><span lang=EN-GB
style='mso-bidi-font-family:"DejaVu Sans"'><!--[if gte vml 1]><v:shapetype
 id="_x0000_t75" coordsize="21600,21600" o:spt="75" o:preferrelative="t"
 path="m@4@5l@4@11@9@11@9@5xe" filled="f" stroked="f">
 <v:stroke joinstyle="miter"/>
 <v:formulas>
  <v:f eqn="if lineDrawn pixelLineWidth 0"/>
  <v:f eqn="sum @0 1 0"/>
  <v:f eqn="sum 0 0 @1"/>
  <v:f eqn="prod @2 1 2"/>
  <v:f eqn="prod @3 21600 pixelWidth"/>
  <v:f eqn="prod @3 21600 pixelHeight"/>
  <v:f eqn="sum @0 0 1"/>
  <v:f eqn="prod @6 1 2"/>
  <v:f eqn="prod @7 21600 pixelWidth"/>
  <v:f eqn="sum @8 21600 0"/>
  <v:f eqn="prod @7 21600 pixelHeight"/>
  <v:f eqn="sum @10 21600 0"/>
 </v:formulas>
 <v:path o:extrusionok="f" gradientshapeok="t" o:connecttype="rect"/>
 <o:lock v:ext="edit" aspectratio="t"/>
</v:shapetype><v:shape id="_x0000_i1025" type="#_x0000_t75" style='width:458.25pt;
 height:204.75pt'>
 <v:imagedata src="http://uva.onlinejudge.org/external/114/i_files/image002.jpg"  o:title="p3810"/>
</v:shape><![endif]--><![if !vml]><img width=611 height=273
src="http://uva.onlinejudge.org/external/114/i_files/image002.jpg"  v:shapes="_x0000_i1025"><![endif]></span><span
lang=EN-GB style='mso-fareast-font-family:"DejaVu Sans";mso-bidi-font-family:
"DejaVu Sans";mso-ansi-language:EN-US'><span style='mso-spacerun:yes'> </span></span><span
style='mso-fareast-font-family:"DejaVu Sans";mso-bidi-font-family:"DejaVu Sans";
mso-ansi-language:EN-US'><o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoBodyText><span lang=EN-GB>The following physical principles are
helpful in solving this problem (some of these are approximations that are
acceptable for the purposes of this problem): </span></p>

<p class=MsoBodyText align=left style='margin-left:35.35pt;text-align:left;
text-indent:-14.15pt;mso-pagination:none;mso-list:l0 level1 lfo2;mso-hyphenate:
none;tab-stops:35.35pt'><![if !supportLists]><span style='font-size:9.0pt;
font-family:Symbol;mso-fareast-font-family:Symbol;mso-bidi-font-family:Symbol;
mso-ansi-language:EN-US'><span style='mso-list:Ignore'>·<span style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
</span></span></span><![endif]><span style='mso-fareast-font-family:"DejaVu Sans";
mso-bidi-font-family:"DejaVu Sans";mso-ansi-language:EN-US'>Water flows
downhill. <o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoBodyText align=left style='margin-left:35.35pt;text-align:left;
text-indent:-14.15pt;mso-pagination:none;mso-list:l0 level1 lfo2;mso-hyphenate:
none;tab-stops:35.35pt'><![if !supportLists]><span style='font-size:9.0pt;
font-family:Symbol;mso-fareast-font-family:Symbol;mso-bidi-font-family:Symbol;
mso-ansi-language:EN-US'><span style='mso-list:Ignore'>·<span style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
</span></span></span><![endif]><span style='mso-fareast-font-family:"DejaVu Sans";
mso-bidi-font-family:"DejaVu Sans";mso-ansi-language:EN-US'>In an open space,
the air pressure is equal to one atmosphere. <o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoBodyText align=left style='margin-left:35.35pt;text-align:left;
text-indent:-14.15pt;mso-pagination:none;mso-list:l0 level1 lfo2;mso-hyphenate:
none;tab-stops:35.35pt'><![if !supportLists]><span style='font-size:9.0pt;
font-family:Symbol;mso-fareast-font-family:Symbol;mso-bidi-font-family:Symbol;
mso-ansi-language:EN-US'><span style='mso-list:Ignore'>·<span style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
</span></span></span><![endif]><span style='mso-fareast-font-family:"DejaVu Sans";
mso-bidi-font-family:"DejaVu Sans";mso-ansi-language:EN-US'>Air is compressible
(the volume occupied by a given amount of air depends on pressure). Water is
not compressible (the volume occupied by a given amount of water is constant,
independent of pressure). <o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoBodyText align=left style='margin-left:35.35pt;text-align:left;
text-indent:-14.15pt;mso-pagination:none;mso-list:l0 level1 lfo2;mso-hyphenate:
none;tab-stops:35.35pt'><![if !supportLists]><span style='font-size:9.0pt;
font-family:Symbol;mso-fareast-font-family:Symbol;mso-bidi-font-family:Symbol;
mso-ansi-language:EN-US'><span style='mso-list:Ignore'>·<span style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
</span></span></span><![endif]><span style='mso-fareast-font-family:"DejaVu Sans";
mso-bidi-font-family:"DejaVu Sans";mso-ansi-language:EN-US'>Air pressure is the
same everywhere within a closed space. If the volume of the closed space
changes, the product of the volume and the air pressure within the space
remains constant. For example, suppose an enclosed airspace has an initial
volume <i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>V</i></span><span
style='font-size:9.5pt;mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;mso-fareast-font-family:"DejaVu Sans";
mso-bidi-font-family:"DejaVu Sans";position:relative;top:1.5pt;mso-text-raise:
-1.5pt;mso-ansi-language:EN-US'>1</span><span style='mso-fareast-font-family:
"DejaVu Sans";mso-bidi-font-family:"DejaVu Sans";mso-ansi-language:EN-US'><span
style='mso-spacerun:yes'> </span>and pressure <i style='mso-bidi-font-style:
normal'>P</i></span><span style='font-size:9.5pt;mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;
mso-fareast-font-family:"DejaVu Sans";mso-bidi-font-family:"DejaVu Sans";
position:relative;top:1.5pt;mso-text-raise:-1.5pt;mso-ansi-language:EN-US'>1</span><span
style='mso-fareast-font-family:"DejaVu Sans";mso-bidi-font-family:"DejaVu Sans";
mso-ansi-language:EN-US'>. If the volume of the airspace changes to <i
style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>V</i></span><span style='font-size:9.5pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;mso-fareast-font-family:"DejaVu Sans";mso-bidi-font-family:
"DejaVu Sans";position:relative;top:1.5pt;mso-text-raise:-1.5pt;mso-ansi-language:
EN-US'>2</span><span style='mso-fareast-font-family:"DejaVu Sans";mso-bidi-font-family:
"DejaVu Sans";mso-ansi-language:EN-US'>, then the new pressure <i
style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>P</i></span><span style='font-size:9.5pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;mso-fareast-font-family:"DejaVu Sans";mso-bidi-font-family:
"DejaVu Sans";position:relative;top:1.5pt;mso-text-raise:-1.5pt;mso-ansi-language:
EN-US'>2</span><span style='mso-fareast-font-family:"DejaVu Sans";mso-bidi-font-family:
"DejaVu Sans";mso-ansi-language:EN-US'><span style='mso-spacerun:yes'> </span><span
class=GramE>satisfies<span style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span><i
style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>P</i><span style='font-size:9.5pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;position:relative;top:1.5pt;mso-text-raise:-1.5pt'>1</span><i
style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>V</i><span style='font-size:9.5pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;position:relative;top:1.5pt;mso-text-raise:-1.5pt'>1</span></span><span
style='mso-spacerun:yes'> </span>= <i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>P</i></span><i
style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'><span style='font-size:9.5pt;mso-bidi-font-size:
12.0pt;mso-fareast-font-family:"DejaVu Sans";mso-bidi-font-family:"DejaVu Sans";
position:relative;top:1.5pt;mso-text-raise:-1.5pt;mso-ansi-language:EN-US'>2</span></i><i
style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'><span style='mso-fareast-font-family:"DejaVu Sans";
mso-bidi-font-family:"DejaVu Sans";mso-ansi-language:EN-US'>V</span></i><i
style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'><span style='font-size:9.5pt;mso-bidi-font-size:
12.0pt;mso-fareast-font-family:"DejaVu Sans";mso-bidi-font-family:"DejaVu Sans";
position:relative;top:1.5pt;mso-text-raise:-1.5pt;mso-ansi-language:EN-US'>2</span></i><span
style='mso-fareast-font-family:"DejaVu Sans";mso-bidi-font-family:"DejaVu Sans";
mso-ansi-language:EN-US'>.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoBodyText align=left style='margin-left:35.35pt;text-align:left;
text-indent:-14.15pt;mso-pagination:none;mso-list:l0 level1 lfo2;mso-hyphenate:
none;tab-stops:35.35pt'><![if !supportLists]><span style='font-size:9.0pt;
font-family:Symbol;mso-fareast-font-family:Symbol;mso-bidi-font-family:Symbol;
mso-ansi-language:EN-US'><span style='mso-list:Ignore'>·<span style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
</span></span></span><![endif]><span style='mso-fareast-font-family:"DejaVu Sans";
mso-bidi-font-family:"DejaVu Sans";mso-ansi-language:EN-US'>In a column of
water below an airspace, the water pressure at a level <i style='mso-bidi-font-style:
normal'>D</i> meters below the water surface is equal to the air pressure at
the surface plus <span class=GramE>0.097<span style='font-size:9.5pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;position:relative;top:-2.5pt;mso-text-raise:2.5pt'> .</span></span></span><span
style='font-size:9.5pt;mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;mso-fareast-font-family:"DejaVu Sans";
mso-bidi-font-family:"DejaVu Sans";position:relative;top:-2.5pt;mso-text-raise:
2.5pt;mso-ansi-language:EN-US'><span style='mso-spacerun:yes'> </span></span><i
style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'><span style='mso-fareast-font-family:"DejaVu Sans";
mso-bidi-font-family:"DejaVu Sans";mso-ansi-language:EN-US'>D </span></i><span
style='mso-fareast-font-family:"DejaVu Sans";mso-bidi-font-family:"DejaVu Sans";
mso-ansi-language:EN-US'>atmospheres. This is true regardless of whether the
airspace is open or enclosed.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><span style='mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;mso-fareast-font-family:
"DejaVu Sans";mso-bidi-font-family:"DejaVu Sans";color:windowtext'>In a
connected body of water (for example, when two or more tanks are connected by
pipes below the water line), the water pressure is constant at any given level.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><span style='mso-ansi-language:EN-GB'><span
style='mso-spacerun:yes'> </span></span><span style='mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;
mso-fareast-font-family:"DejaVu Sans";mso-bidi-font-family:"DejaVu Sans";
color:windowtext'><o:p></o:p></span></p>

<h5><span class=StyleArial16pt><span style='font-size:16.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:
10.0pt'>Input<o:p></o:p></span></span></h5>

<p class=MsoBodyText><span lang=EN-GB>The input consists of several test cases
representing different series of water tanks. Each test case has three lines of
data. The first line contains an integer <i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>N
(2</i> &lt;= <i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>N &lt;= </i>10) which is the
number of tanks in the test case. The second line contains <i style='mso-bidi-font-style:
normal'>N</i> positive floating point numbers that are the heights, in meters,
of tanks 1 through <span class=GramE><i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>N</i>
.</span> The third line contains <i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>N</i> -
1 floating point numbers. On this line, the <i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>k</i>
<span class=SpellE>th</span> number represents the height above the ground of
the pipe that connects tank <i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>k</i> and
tank <i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>k</i> + <span class=GramE>1 .</span></span></p>

<p class=MsoBodyText><span lang=EN-GB>The last test case is followed by a line
containing the integer zero. </span></p>

<p class=MsoBodyText><span lang=EN-GB><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoBodyText><span lang=EN-GB>The input is terminated by a line
containing a single integer zero. </span></p>

<h4 style='tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><span
class=StyleArial16pt><span style='font-size:16.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></span></h4>

<h4 style='tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><span
class=StyleArial16pt><span style='font-size:16.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt'>Output
<o:p></o:p></span></span></h4>

<p class=MsoBodyText><span lang=EN-GB>For each test case, print a line
containing the test case number (beginning with 1) followed by the amount of
water, in cubic meters, that can be poured into tank 1 before the water level
reaches the top of tank 1. Print the results with three digits to the right of
the decimal point. </span></p>

<p class=MsoBodyText><span lang=EN-GB><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoBodyText><span lang=EN-GB>Print a blank line after the output for
each test case. Use the format of the sample output. </span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p>

<h1 style='tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><span
style='font-size:16.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal;mso-bidi-font-style:italic'>Sample Input<span
style='mso-spacerun:yes'>                 </span><span style='mso-tab-count:
2'>            </span><span style='mso-spacerun:yes'>     </span>Output for
Sample Input<o:p></o:p></span></h1>

<table class=MsoNormalTable border=1 cellspacing=0 cellpadding=0
 style='background:#CCCCCC;border-collapse:collapse;border:none;mso-border-alt:
 solid windowtext .5pt;mso-padding-alt:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
 <tr style='mso-yfti-irow:0;mso-yfti-firstrow:yes;mso-yfti-lastrow:yes'>
  <td width=319 valign=top style='width:239.4pt;border:solid windowtext 1.0pt;
  mso-border-alt:solid windowtext .5pt;padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
  <p class=PreformattedText>2 </p>
  <p class=PreformattedText>10.0 8.0 </p>
  <p class=PreformattedText>4.0 </p>
  <p class=PreformattedText style='margin-bottom:14.15pt'>0</p>
  <p class=PreformattedText style='margin-bottom:14.15pt'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p>
  </td>
  <td width=324 valign=top style='width:243.0pt;border:solid windowtext 1.0pt;
  border-left:none;mso-border-left-alt:solid windowtext .5pt;mso-border-alt:
  solid windowtext .5pt;padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
  <p class=PreformattedText style='margin-bottom:14.15pt'>Case 1: 15.260</p>
  <pre><span style='font-size:11.0pt'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></pre></td>
 </tr>
</table>

<div class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center;tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'>

<hr size=3 width="100%" align=center>

</div>

class=SpellE>Chamberlin</span><strong><span style='font-family:Arial;
mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>, ACM ICPC World Finals 2007::Problem I<o:p></o:p></span></strong></p>

<title>Problem J - Where is the back button?</title>

<body lang=EN-US link="#009999" vlink=purple style='tab-interval:.5in'>

<div class=Section1>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><span style='font-size:28.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:
Arial'>Problem J</span></b><span style='font-family:Arial'><br>
</span><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style='font-size:20.0pt;
font-family:Arial'>Where is the back button?</span></b><span
style='font-family:Arial'><br>
<b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>Input: </b><span style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
bold'>Standard Input<o:p></o:p></span></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><span style='font-family:Arial'>Output: </span></b><span
style='font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'>Standard Output <o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'>&nbsp;</p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;mso-line-height-alt:11.0pt'>The
employees of the <span class=SpellE>Dendrogram</span> Workless Inc. do their
tasks through a local intranet application with web page like interface. Every
single worker has a designated homepage with all his tasks. According to the
companys new security policy, no worker is allowed to visit any other
personnels homepage. But the old pages might contain some links to other pages
(or even a link to itself.) Instead of removing links from working pages, they
introduce a new web browser without the back button and make the employees
use this new browser. The idea is<span class=GramE>,</span> no employee can
leave his designated page because without a back button there is no assurance
that a worker will find a path to return to his home page just when the boss
comes in! The employees soon get bored and decide that they would like to visit
other pages. So, they plan to insert new links as necessary to their pages so
that every single employee can return to his home page after clicking one or
more links without using the back button. You are to help them by finding the
minimum number of links to insert.</p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p>

<h5 style='text-align:justify'><span class=StyleArial16pt><span
style='font-size:16.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt'>Input</span></span><span
class=StyleArial16pt><span style='font-size:16.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;
mso-fareast-font-family:"Arial Unicode MS"'><o:p></o:p></span></span></h5>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;mso-line-height-alt:11.0pt'>The
first line of the input states the number of test cases in the input. Each test
case begins with two integers  The number of pages in the system, P (1 &#8804;
P &#8804; 20) &amp; <span class=GramE>The</span> number of links, L (0 &#8804; L
&#8804; (P * (P-1)/2)). The pages are denoted by integers from 0 to P-1. Each
of the next L lines contains two integers A &amp; B (0 &#8804; A<span
class=GramE>,B</span> &#8804; P-1) implying that page A has a link to page B.</p>

<p class=MsoNormal><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p>

<h4><span class=StyleArial16pt><span style='font-size:16.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:
10.0pt'>Output <o:p></o:p></span></span></h4>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;mso-line-height-alt:11.0pt'>For
each test case, print the minimum number of links to be inserted.</p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;tab-stops:143.25pt'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p>

<h1><span style='font-size:16.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;font-family:Arial;
mso-bidi-font-weight:normal;mso-bidi-font-style:italic'>Sample Input<span
style='mso-spacerun:yes'>                              </span>Output for Sample
Input<o:p></o:p></span></h1>

<table class=MsoNormalTable border=1 cellspacing=0 cellpadding=0
 style='background:#CCCCCC;border-collapse:collapse;border:none;mso-border-alt:
 solid windowtext .5pt;mso-padding-alt:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
 <tr style='mso-yfti-irow:0;mso-yfti-firstrow:yes;mso-yfti-lastrow:yes'>
  <td width=313 valign=top style='width:234.9pt;border:solid windowtext 1.0pt;
  mso-border-alt:solid windowtext .5pt;padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;mso-line-height-alt:11.0pt'><span
  style='font-family:"Courier New"'>2<o:p></o:p></span></p>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;mso-line-height-alt:11.0pt'><span
  style='font-family:"Courier New"'>5 <span class=SpellE>5</span><o:p></o:p></span></p>

  <p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;mso-line-height-alt:11.0pt'><span
  style='font-family:"Courier New"'>3 0<o:p></o:p></span></p>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='mso-layout-grid-align:none;text-autospace:none'><span
  style='font-family:"Courier New"'>0 1<o:p></o:p></span></p>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='mso-layout-grid-align:none;text-autospace:none'><b><span
  style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width=330 valign=top style='width:247.5pt;border:solid windowtext 1.0pt;
  border-left:none;mso-border-left-alt:solid windowtext .5pt;mso-border-alt:
  solid windowtext .5pt;padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;mso-line-height-alt:11.0pt'><span
  style='font-family:"Courier New"'>1<o:p></o:p></span></p>
  <p class=MsoNormal><span style='font-family:"Courier New"'>0<o:p></o:p></span></p>
  <p class=MsoNormal><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><span

11447||||||false||||||
<html>

<head>
<meta http-equiv="Content-Type" content="text/html; charset=iso-8859-1">
<title>Reservoir Logs</title>
</head>

<body bgcolor="#FFFFFF" lang="EN">
<div align="center"><center>

<table border="0" bgcolor="#0060F0">
<TBODY>
  <tr>
    <td><b><font color="#C0FFFF" size="5">&nbsp;A. Reservoir Logs&nbsp;</font></b></td>
  </tr>
</TBODY>
</table>
</center></div>

<h2><font color="#0070E8">Background</font></h2>

<p>Lack of rain in Spain is becoming a serious problem. A decrease in annual rainfall
since the 1970s is said to have produced the present low reservoir levels. Although
reservoirs across the country are running at an average capacity of less than 50 percent,
in the worst affected areas such as Murcia, the capacity in many reservoirs is said to be
less than 20 percent.</p>

<p>You are a scientist that must compute each month the capacity, in percentage, of water
of a given reservoir.</p>

<h2><font color="#0070E8">The Problem</font></h2>

<p>A reservoir is described by a list of coordinates (<em>P</em>[1]<em>, P</em>[2]<em>,
..., P</em>[<em>N</em>]) which define its cross section, and the width <em>W</em> of the
reservoir, as shown in the figure below. The points that define the cross section always
go from the left to the right, i.e., <em>P</em>[<em>i</em>].x &lt;= <em>P</em>[<em>i</em>+1].x.</p>

<p align="center"><img src="http://uva.onlinejudge.org/external/114/p11447.gif"  width="527" height="246"><br>
<em>Cross section of the reservoir: Both dimensions and coordinates are given in metres.</em></p>

<p>We know the level of the reservoir at the beginning of the month (as a percentage).
Also, we know the amount of water consumed due to evaporation and population use, and the
amount of water falling on the reservoir because of rain (both measures are given in cubic
metres). We suppose that water consumption only happens in the first half of the month,
and the rain in the second half (so, in the same month, we can have a lack of water and
then an excess of water).</p>

<h2><font color="#0070E8">The Input</font></h2>

<p>The first line of the input contains an integer <em>T</em> (0 &lt; <em>T</em> &lt;
200), indicating the number of test cases. Test cases are separated by blank lines.</p>

<p>Each test case starts with a line containing the number <em>N</em> (2 &lt; <em>N</em>
&lt; 10000) of coordinate pairs (<em>x</em>, <em>y</em>) of the reservoir, with <em>x</em>
&gt;= 0 and <em>y</em> &lt;= 0. The following <em>N</em> lines for each test case contain
the coordinates defining the reservoir's cross section (two integer numbers per line). The
first and last coordinates always have <em>y</em> = 0. Coordinates are always in order
from left to right. The following line contains only an integer <em>W</em> indicating the
width of the reservoir.</p>

<p>Finally, each test case ends with a line containing three real numbers representing:
the initial percentage of water in the reservoir, the amount of spent water (in cubic
metres), and the amount of water falling over the reservoir (also in cubic metres),
respectively.</p>

<h2><font color="#0070E8">The Output</font></h2>

<p>For each test case, you must write a line with the text &quot;<code>Final percentage: <em>X</em>%</code>&quot;,
where <em>X</em> is an integer number between 0 and 100 indicating the final capacity (as
a percentage) of the reservoir; you have to take the integer part of the result (rounding
down).</p>

<p>If the amount of water consumed is greater than the initial capacity of the reservoir,
you must write the string &quot;<code>Lack of water. </code>&quot; before the previous
text (observe that it ends with a blank space).</p>

<p>If the final amount of water exceeds the potential capacity of the reservoir, you must
write &quot;<code>Excess of water. </code>&quot; (observe that it ends with a blank space)
before the final percentage and, if it appears, after the &quot;lack of water&quot; text.</p>

<p>Note that in some cases the three texts may appear. Remember: first there is a water
consumption and then water recovering by the rain.</p>

<h2><font color="#0070E8">Sample Input</font></h2>

<pre>3

4
0 0
0 -2
2 -2
2 0
1
50.0 2.0 1.0

9
0 0
9 -2
11 -1
16 -3
22 -3
23 0
28 -2
28 -4
36 0
2
84.2 178.24 991.00

3
0 0
1 -1
2 0
100
0.01 23.00 49.99
</pre>

<h2><font color="#0070E8">Sample Output</font></h2>

<pre>Final percentage: 25%
Lack of water. Excess of water. Final percentage: 100%
Lack of water. Final percentage: 49%
</pre>
</body>
</html>

______________________________________________________
11448||||||false||||||
<html>

<head>
<meta name="description" content="By GinesGM">
<title>Who Said Crisis?</title>
</head>

<body bgcolor="#FFFFFF" lang="EN">
<div align="center"><center>

<table border="0" bgcolor="#0060F0">
<TBODY>
  <tr>
    <td><font color="#C0FFFF" size="5"><b>&nbsp;B. Who Said Crisis?&nbsp;</b></font></td>
  </tr>
</TBODY>
</table>
</center></div>

<h2><font color="#0070E8">Context</font></h2>

<p>The company Assistance for Critical Moments (ACM) is helping other companies to
overcome the current economical crisis. As experts in computing machinery, their job is to
calculate the cost/benefit balance of the other companies. They receive two numbers,
indicating the total amount of benefits and costs, and they have to compute the final
balance.</p>

<h2><font color="#0070E8">The Problem</font></h2>

<p>You have to solve the complex business problem of computing balances. You are given two
positive integer numbers, corresponding to the benefits and the costs. You have to obtain
the total balance, i.e., the difference between benefits and costs.</p>

<h2><font color="#0070E8">The Input</font></h2>

<p>The first line of the input contains an integer indicating the number of test cases.</p>

<p>For each test case, there is a line with two positive integer numbers, <em>A</em> and <em>B</em>,
corresponding to the benefits and the costs, respectively. Both numbers are between 0 and
a googol (10<sup>100</sup>) to the power of a hundred.</p>

<h2><font color="#0070E8">The Output</font></h2>

<p>For each test case, the output should consist of a line indicating the balance: <em>A</em>-<em>B</em>.</p>

<h2><font color="#0070E8">Sample Input</font></h2>

<pre>4
10 3
4 9
0 8
5 2
</pre>

<h2><font color="#0070E8">Sample Output</font></h2>

<pre>7
-5
-8
3
</pre>
</body>
</html>

______________________________________________________
11449||||||false||||||
<html>

<head>
<meta name="description" content="Go Alonso Go!">
<meta name="author" content="GinesGM">
<title>Go Alonso Go!</title>
</head>

<body bgcolor="#FFFFFF" lang="EN">
<div align="center"><center>

<table border="0" bgcolor="#0060F0">
<TBODY>
  <tr>
    <td><font color="#C0FFFF" size="5"><b>&nbsp;C. Go Alonso Go!&nbsp;</b></font></td>
  </tr>
</TBODY>
</table>
</center></div>

<h2><font color="#0070E8">Context</font></h2>

<p>Deciding the optimum number of pit stops in a Formula One race is not a trivial matter.
The problem is greatly influenced by many factors: the length of the circuit and the total
number of laps, the time lost in each pit stop, the maximum tank capacity of the car, the
fuel consumption per kilometer, the relationship between speed and current weight of the
fuel, etc.</p>

<p>You have been hired by the prestigious F1 team SlowCheapCars in order to decide their
optimum pit stops strategy. Help them to win the race.</p>

<h2><font color="#0070E8">The Problem</font></h2>

<p>Each time we do a pit stop, some precious seconds are lost. In particular, there are
two components:

<ul>
  <li>A constant time, <strong>G</strong>, due to slowing down, stopping, and accelerating
    back up to normal speed; and</li>
  <li>A variable quantity, <strong>x*H</strong>, depending on the number of litres added to
    the tank (<strong>x</strong>) and the speed of the highly pressurized refueling system (<strong>H</strong>,
    in seconds/litre).</li>
</ul>

<p>Besides, the average speed of the car per lap is not constant; on the contrary, it
depends on the fuel load at a given moment. When the tank is full, the car is normally
slower because of its total weight. But when it is almost empty, the car is able to go
faster. This variation is given by the number of seconds gained per lap when the fuel load
is reduced 10 litres, <strong>F</strong> (in seconds per 10 litres). For example, let <strong>E</strong>
be the time to complete a lap starting with the full tank, and let <strong>D</strong> be
this maximum capacity of the tank; if the current fuel load is <strong>D</strong>-20
litres, the lap time will be: <strong>E</strong>-2<strong>F</strong>.</p>

<p>The initial fuel load of the car is given by <strong>C</strong> (in litres). However,
according to a recent regulation by the F.R.I.A., we have the possibility to start the
race from the pit line; in that case, we are free to decide the initial fuel load, at the
expense of losing <strong>I</strong> seconds in the first lap.</p>

<p>Some other parameters of the problem are the total number of laps of the race, <strong>A</strong>,
the length of the circuit, <strong>B</strong> (in kilometers), the fuel consumption per
lap, <strong>J</strong>, and the name of the circuit, <strong>N</strong>.</p>

<p>A <strong>pit stop strategy</strong> is given by the number of stops and the decision
whether to start or not from the pit
line. We want to obtain the optimum strategy of pit stops in a given circuit, that is, the
one that produces the minimum total time to complete the <strong>A</strong> laps.
Obviously, the fuel load of the car can never be below 0.</p>

<h2><font color="#0070E8">The Input</font></h2>

<p>The first line of the input contains an integer <em>M</em>, indicating the number of
test cases.</p>

<p>For each test case, there are the following lines (the text in <strong>bold</strong>
appears literally):</p>

<pre><strong>Circuit</strong> N
A B
<strong>Fuel</strong>
C D
<strong>Speed</strong>
E F
<strong>Pit stop</strong>
G H I
<strong>Consumption</strong>
J</pre>

<p>Where:

<ul>
  <p><strong>A</strong>: number of laps of the race (from 1 to 100). Integer.<br>
  <strong>B</strong>: length of the circuit, i.e., kilometers per lap. Real with 2 decimal
  digits.<br>
  <strong>C</strong>: initial fuel in the tank of the car, in litres (from 1 to 200).
  Integer.<br>
  <strong>D</strong>: maximum capacity of the tank of the car, in litres (from 1 to 200, and
  0&lt;=<strong>C</strong>&lt;=<strong>D</strong>). Integer.<br>
  <strong>E</strong>: number of seconds per lap starting the lap with the full tank. Real
  with 2 decimal digits.<br>
  <strong>F</strong>: number of seconds per lap gained for each reduction of 10 litres in
  fuel load. Real with 1 decimal digit. It could be negative.<br>
  <strong>G</strong>: constant time lost in each pit stop, in seconds. Real with 2 decimal
  digits.<br>
  <strong>H</strong>: seconds per litre lost in the pit stop to refuel the car. Real with 2
  decimal digits.<br>
  <strong>I</strong>: seconds lost in the first lap if we decide to start from the pit line.
  Real with 2 decimal digits.<br>
  <strong>J</strong>: litres of fuel consumed per lap (it is supposed to be independent of
  the speed, and <strong>J</strong>&lt;=<strong>D</strong>). Integer.<br>
  <strong>N</strong>: the name of the circuit. String.<br>
  </p>
</ul>

<p>Observe that fuel is always considered to be an integer value, while time is given in
seconds with 2 decimal digits (rounding is not required in this problem).</p>

<h2><font color="#0070E8">The Output</font></h2>

<p>For each test case, the output should contain the following lines (the text in <strong>bold</strong>
must appear literally):</p>

<pre><strong>Circuit</strong> N
<strong>Estimated time</strong>
T
<strong>Initial fuel</strong>
K
<strong>Pit stops</strong>
S
</pre>

<p>Where:

<ul>
  <p><strong>T</strong>: estimated time (in seconds) to complete the <strong>A</strong> laps
  of the race using the optimum strategy. Real with 2 decimal digits.<br>
  <strong>K</strong>: initial fuel load; if <strong>K</strong> is not equal to <strong>C</strong>,
  it means that we start the race from the pit line. Integer.<br>
  <strong>S</strong>: optimum number of pits stops. Integer.<br>
  </p>
</ul>

<p>You can suppose that the solution always exists and is unique.</p>

<h2><font color="#0070E8">Sample Input</font></h2>

<pre>4
Circuit of Monte Carlo
78 3.34
Fuel
70 160
Speed
79.22 0.3
Pit stop
24.51 0.11 18.54
Consumption
4
Circuit of Hockenheim
67 4.57
Fuel
60 180
Speed
81.32 0.3
Pit stop
22.81 0.09 21.33
Consumption
5
Circuit of Valencia
57 5.44
Fuel
57 150
Speed
72.32 0.2
Pit stop
22.01 0.13 20.12
Consumption
5
Circuit of Moon Park
60 6.21
Fuel
10 160
Speed
76.32 -0.3
Pit stop
10.00 0.26 15.25
Consumption
6
</pre>

<h2><font color="#0070E8">Sample Output</font></h2>

<pre>Circuit of Monte Carlo
Estimated time
6002.41
Initial fuel
70
Pit stops
3
Circuit of Hockenheim
Estimated time
5271.32
Initial fuel
60
Pit stops
3
Circuit of Valencia
Estimated time
4087.14
Initial fuel
57
Pit stops
2
Circuit of Moon Park
Estimated time
4763.39
Initial fuel
160
Pit stops
4
</pre>
</body>
</html>
