 <o:OLEObject Type="Embed" ProgID="Equation.3" ShapeID="_x0000_i1037"
  DrawAspect="Content" ObjectID="_1282574601">
 </o:OLEObject>
</xml><![endif]-->.</span></p>

<h5 style='text-align:justify;tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><span
class=StyleArial16pt><span style='font-size:16.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:13.0pt;
line-height:115%;font-family:"Times New Roman";mso-bidi-font-weight:normal;
font-style:normal;mso-bidi-font-style:italic'>Input</span></span><span
class=StyleArial16pt><span style='font-size:16.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:13.0pt;
line-height:115%;font-family:"Times New Roman";mso-fareast-font-family:"Arial Unicode MS";
mso-bidi-font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;mso-bidi-font-style:italic'><o:p></o:p></span></span></h5>

<p class=MsoNormal style='line-height:normal;tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><span
style='font-size:12.0pt;font-family:"Times New Roman"'>The input file contains
100 sets of inputs. The description of each set is given below<span
class=GramE>:The</span> input for each set is contained in a single line. This
line starts with an integer <span class=GramE>N(</span>0&lt;N&lt;101) which
denotes how many numbers are in the set S. This integer is followed by N
non-negative floating-point numbers in the same line. To make things easy with
floating-point numbers and to avoid precision problems these numbers have only
a single digit after the decimal point. Also the values of any of these numbers
are not greater than 1000.<br>
Input is terminated by line containing a single zero.</span><span
style='font-size:12.0pt'><o:p></o:p></span></p>

<h4 style='tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><span
class=StyleArial16pt><span style='font-size:16.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:14.0pt;
line-height:115%;font-family:"Times New Roman";mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>Output
<o:p></o:p></span></span></h4>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;line-height:normal;tab-stops:121.5pt'><span
style='font-size:12.0pt;font-family:"Times New Roman"'>For each set of input
produce one line of output. This line contains an integer which denotes the
value of A.</span><span style='font-size:12.0pt'><o:p></o:p></span></p>

<h1 align=left style='text-align:left;tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><b><span
style='font-size:16.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-style:normal'>Sample
Input</span></b><b><span style='font-size:16.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;
font-family:Arial;font-style:normal'><span
style='mso-spacerun:yes'>                          </span><span
style='mso-spacerun:yes'>     </span></span></b><b><span style='font-size:16.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-style:normal'>Output for Sample Input</span></b><b><span
style='font-size:16.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;font-style:
normal'><o:p></o:p></span></b></h1>

  style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:11.0pt;line-height:115%;
  font-family:"Courier New"'>1 11.4<br>
  4 537.0 365.1 870.2 841.7<br>
  2 216.5 4.8<br>
  0<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width=322 valign=top style='width:3.35in;border:solid windowtext 1.0pt;

	font-family:Calibri;
	mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman";
	mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman";}

<!--[if gte mso 10]>
<style>
 /* Style Definitions */

	{mso-style-name:"Table Normal";
	mso-tstyle-rowband-size:0;

<body lang=EN-US link=blue vlink=purple style='tab-interval:.5in'>

<div class=Section1>

<table class=MsoNormalTable border=1 cellspacing=0 cellpadding=0 width=641
 style='width:480.9pt;background:#CCCCCC;border-collapse:collapse;border:none;
 mso-border-alt:solid windowtext .5pt;mso-padding-alt:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
 <tr style='mso-yfti-irow:0;mso-yfti-firstrow:yes;mso-yfti-lastrow:yes;
  height:67.25pt'>
  <td width=97 valign=top style='width:73.1pt;border:solid windowtext 1.0pt;
  mso-border-alt:solid windowtext .25pt;background:#E6E6E6;padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt;
  height:67.25pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal align=center style='margin-bottom:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;
  text-align:center;line-height:normal;tab-stops:143.25pt'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
  normal'><span style='font-size:72.0pt;font-family:Arial'>F<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width=544 style='width:407.8pt;border:solid windowtext 1.0pt;border-left:
  none;mso-border-left-alt:solid windowtext .25pt;mso-border-alt:solid windowtext .25pt;
  background:transparent;padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt;height:67.25pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal align=center style='margin-bottom:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;
  text-align:center;line-height:normal;tab-stops:143.25pt'><span
  style='font-size:36.0pt;font-family:Impact'>Finding Paths in Grid</span><span
  style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial'><o:p></o:p></span></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
</table>

<p class=ListParagraph style='tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><span
style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:16.0pt;line-height:115%;font-family:
Garamond'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p style='text-align:justify;tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><span
class=GramE>Given a grid having <b>7</b> columns.</span> <b>4</b> players will
start there journey in that grid. Initially all of them are in first row. A
player can move diagonally to the next row. For example, a player is in row 3
and column 4, which can also be represented as (3<span class=GramE>,4</span>),
this player has only two valid moves, (4,3) and (4,5). But If the player is in
(3, 1), he has only one valid move, which is (4<span class=GramE>,2</span>). In
there journey, any cell of the grid can not be visited more than one player. </p>

<p style='text-align:justify;tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'>In
this problem you have to find, in how many ways all of the players can reach to
row <b>N</b>.</p>

<h5 style='text-align:justify;tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><span
class=StyleArial16pt><span style='font-size:16.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:13.0pt;
line-height:115%;mso-bidi-font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;mso-bidi-font-style:
italic'>Input</span></span><span style='font-size:16.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:
13.0pt;line-height:115%;font-family:Arial;mso-fareast-font-family:"Arial Unicode MS";
mso-bidi-font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;mso-bidi-font-style:italic'><o:p></o:p></span></h5>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><span
style='font-size:12.0pt;line-height:115%;font-family:"Times New Roman"'>The
first line of input is an integer <span class=style31><span style='mso-ansi-font-size:
12.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;line-height:115%;font-family:"Times New Roman"'>T</span></span>
(<span class=style31><span style='mso-ansi-font-size:12.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:
12.0pt;line-height:115%;font-family:"Times New Roman"'>T&lt;100</span></span>)
that indicates the number of test cases. Each case starts with a line
containing only 1 integer <span class=style31><span style='mso-ansi-font-size:
12.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;line-height:115%;font-family:"Times New Roman"'>N</span></span>
(<span class=style31><span style='mso-ansi-font-size:12.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:
12.0pt;line-height:115%;font-family:"Times New Roman"'>1&#8804;N&#8804;1000000000</span></span>),
followed by a line having <b>7</b> integers <b>(r<sub>1</sub> to r<sub>7</sub>)</b>,
which will represent the state of first row. <span class=GramE><b>r<sub>i</sub></b></span><b>
= 0</b> represents that, there is no player in row <b>i</b>, otherwise <b>r<sub>i</sub></b>
will represent the player number. Player numbers will be <span class=GramE>between
<b>1</b> to <b>4</b></span>. <o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p style='tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><span
class=StyleArial16pt><span style='font-size:16.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt'>Output</span></span><span
style='font-family:Arial'><o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p style='text-align:justify;tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'>For
each case, output the number of ways to reach row N. You have to give your
output modulo 1000000007.<span style='mso-bidi-font-size:16.0pt;font-family:
Garamond'><o:p></o:p></span></p>

<h1 align=left style='text-align:left;tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><b><span
style='font-size:16.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;font-style:
normal'>Sample Input<span style='mso-spacerun:yes'>                            
</span>Output for Sample Input<o:p></o:p></span></b></h1>

<table class=MsoNormalTable border=1 cellspacing=0 cellpadding=0
 style='background:#CCCCCC;border-collapse:collapse;border:none;mso-border-alt:
 solid windowtext .5pt;mso-padding-alt:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
 <tr style='mso-yfti-irow:0;mso-yfti-firstrow:yes;mso-yfti-lastrow:yes'>
  <td width=307 valign=top style='width:3.2in;border:solid windowtext 1.0pt;
  mso-border-alt:solid windowtext .5pt;padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='line-height:normal'><span class=style101><span
  style='mso-ansi-font-size:11.0pt'>3</span></span><b><span style='mso-bidi-font-size:
  10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'><br>
  <span class=style101><span style='mso-ansi-font-size:11.0pt'>1</span></span><br>
  <span class=style101><span style='mso-ansi-font-size:11.0pt'>1 0 2 0 3 0 4</span></span><br>
  <span class=style101><span style='mso-ansi-font-size:11.0pt'>2</span></span><br>
  <span class=style101><span style='mso-ansi-font-size:11.0pt'>1 0 2 0 3 0 4</span></span><br>
  <span class=style101><span style='mso-ansi-font-size:11.0pt'>2</span></span><br>
  <span class=style101><span style='mso-ansi-font-size:11.0pt'>1 2 3 4 0 0 <span
  class=SpellE>0</span><o:p></o:p></span></span></span></b></p>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='line-height:normal'><span style='font-size:12.0pt'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>
  </td>
  <td width=309 valign=top style='width:231.85pt;border:solid windowtext 1.0pt;
  border-left:none;mso-border-left-alt:solid windowtext .5pt;mso-border-alt:
  solid windowtext .5pt;padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='line-height:normal'><span class=style101><span
  style='mso-ansi-font-size:11.0pt'>1</span></span><b><span style='mso-bidi-font-size:
  10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'><br>
  <span class=style101><span style='mso-ansi-font-size:11.0pt'>0</span></span><br>
  <span class=style101><span style='mso-ansi-font-size:11.0pt'>3<o:p></o:p></span></span></span></b></p>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='line-height:normal'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
</table>

<div style='mso-element:para-border-div;border:none;border-bottom:solid windowtext 1.0pt;
mso-border-bottom-alt:solid windowtext .75pt;padding:0in 0in 1.0pt 0in'>

<p class=MsoNormal style='tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt;
border:none;mso-border-bottom-alt:solid windowtext .75pt;padding:0in;
mso-padding-alt:0in 0in 1.0pt 0in'><span style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:
16.0pt;line-height:115%;font-family:Garamond'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

</div>

<p class=MsoNormal style='tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><span
style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:16.0pt;line-height:115%;font-family:
"Times New Roman"'>Problem <span class=GramE>Setter :</span> <st1:place w:st="on"><st1:State
 w:st="on">Md.</st1:State></st1:place> <span class=SpellE>Arifuzzaman</span> <span
class=SpellE>Arif</span><br>
Special Thanks : Abdullah Al <span class=SpellE>Mahmud</span><o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><span
style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:16.0pt;line-height:115%;font-family:

p.HTMLPreformatted, li.HTMLPreformatted, div.HTMLPreformatted
	{mso-style-name:"HTML Preformatted\,Char";
	mso-style-link:"Char Char Char";
	margin:0in;

	mso-pagination:widow-orphan;
	tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt;
	font-size:10.0pt;
	font-family:"Courier New";
	mso-fareast-font-family:"Courier New";}
p.ListParagraph, li.ListParagraph, div.ListParagraph
	{mso-style-name:"List Paragraph";
	margin-top:0in;

	mso-add-space:auto;

<body lang=EN-US link=blue vlink=purple style='tab-interval:.5in'>

<div class=Section1>

<div align=center>

<table class=MsoNormalTable border=1 cellspacing=0 cellpadding=0
 style='border-collapse:collapse;border:none;mso-border-alt:solid windowtext .25pt;
 mso-yfti-tbllook:480;mso-padding-alt:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt;mso-border-insideh:
 .25pt solid windowtext;mso-border-insidev:.25pt solid windowtext'>
 <tr style='mso-yfti-irow:0;mso-yfti-firstrow:yes;mso-yfti-lastrow:yes;
  height:67.25pt'>
  <td width=97 valign=top style='width:73.05pt;border:solid windowtext 1.0pt;
  mso-border-alt:solid windowtext .25pt;background:#E6E6E6;padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt;
  height:67.25pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal align=center style='margin-bottom:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;
  text-align:center;line-height:normal;tab-stops:143.25pt'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
  normal'><span style='font-size:72.0pt;font-family:Arial'>G<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width=541 style='width:405.75pt;border:solid windowtext 1.0pt;border-left:
  none;mso-border-left-alt:solid windowtext .25pt;mso-border-alt:solid windowtext .25pt;
  padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt;height:67.25pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal align=center style='margin-bottom:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;
  text-align:center;line-height:normal;tab-stops:143.25pt'><span
  style='font-size:36.0pt;font-family:Impact;mso-bidi-font-family:Arial'>Gathering
  Food<o:p></o:p></span></p>
  <p class=MsoNormal align=center style='margin-bottom:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;
  text-align:center;line-height:normal;tab-stops:143.25pt'><span
  style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
</table>

</div>

<p class=ListParagraph style='tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><span
style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:16.0pt;line-height:115%;font-family:
Garamond'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;line-height:normal;tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><span
style='font-size:12.0pt;font-family:"Times New Roman"'>Winter is approaching!
The weather is getting colder and days are becoming shorter. The animals take different
measures to adjust themselves during this season. <a name=ANIMALS><o:p></o:p></a></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;line-height:normal;tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><span
style='mso-bookmark:ANIMALS'><span style='font-size:12.0pt;font-family:"Times New Roman"'>-
Some of them &quot;migrate.&quot; This means they travel to other places where
the weather is warmer.</span></span><span style='font-size:12.0pt;font-family:
"Times New Roman"'> <o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;line-height:normal;tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><span
style='font-size:12.0pt;font-family:"Times New Roman"'>-Few animals remain and
stay active in the winter. <o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;line-height:normal;tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><span
style='font-size:12.0pt;font-family:"Times New Roman"'>-Some animals
&quot;hibernate&quot; for all of the winter. This is a very deep sleep. The
animal's body temperature drops, and its heartbeat and breathing slow down. In
the fall, these animals get ready for winter by eating extra food and storing
it as body fat.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;line-height:normal;tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><span
style='font-size:12.0pt;font-family:"Times New Roman"'>For this problem, we are
interested in the 3<sup>rd</sup> example and we will be focusing on Yogi
Bear.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;line-height:normal;tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><span
style='font-size:12.0pt;font-family:"Times New Roman"'>Yogi Bear is in the
middle of some forest. The forest can be modeled as a square grid of size <b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>N x N</b>. Each cell of the grid consists
of one of the following.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style='font-family:"Courier New"'>. <span
class=GramE>an</span> empty space<br>
# an obstacle<br>
[A-Z] an English alphabet<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><span
style='font-size:12.0pt;line-height:115%;font-family:"Times New Roman"'>There
will be at least 1 alphabet and all the letters in the grid will be distinct.
If there are <b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>n</b> letters, then it will
be from the first <b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>n</b> alphabets.
Suppose n = 3, that means there will be exactly 1 A, 1 B and 1 C.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><span
style='font-size:12.0pt;line-height:115%;font-family:"Times New Roman"'>The
letters actually represent foods lying on the ground. Yogi starts from position
A and sets off with a basket in the hope of collecting all other foods. Yogi
can move to a cell if it shares an edge with the current one. For some
superstitious reason, Yogi decides to collect all the foods in order. That is,
he first collects A, then B, then C and so on until he</span> <span
style='font-size:12.0pt;line-height:115%;font-family:"Times New Roman"'>reaches
the food with the highest alphabet value. Another philosophy he follows is that
if he lands on a particular food he must collect it.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><span
style='font-size:12.0pt;line-height:115%;font-family:"Times New Roman"'>Help
Yogi to collect all the foods in minimum number of moves so that he can have a
long sleep in the winter. You are also required to find the total number of
shortest paths he can take that meets the above constraints. <o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><b><span
style='font-size:16.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;line-height:115%;font-family:
Arial'>Input<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><span
style='font-size:12.0pt;line-height:115%;font-family:"Times New Roman"'>There
will be several cases in the input file. Each case starts with, <span
class=GramE><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>N</b>(</span><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>N</b>&lt;=10), the size of the grid. Each
of the next <b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>N</b> lines contains <b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>N</b> characters each. Input ends with a
value of 0 for <b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>N</b>.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><b><span
style='font-size:16.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;line-height:115%;font-family:
Arial'>Output<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><span
style='font-size:12.0pt;line-height:115%;font-family:"Times New Roman"'>For
each case, output the case number first. If its impossible to collect all the
foods, output Impossible. Otherwise, print the shortest distance followed by
the total number of distinct paths. Since the total number of shortest paths
can be very big, output the result modulo <b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>20437</b>.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<h1 align=left style='text-align:left;tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><b><span
style='font-size:16.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;font-style:
normal'>Sample Input<span style='mso-spacerun:yes'>                            
</span>Output for Sample Input<o:p></o:p></span></b></h1>

<table class=MsoNormalTable border=1 cellspacing=0 cellpadding=0
 style='background:#CCCCCC;border-collapse:collapse;border:none;mso-border-alt:
 solid windowtext .5pt;mso-padding-alt:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
 <tr style='mso-yfti-irow:0;mso-yfti-firstrow:yes;mso-yfti-lastrow:yes'>
  <td width=307 valign=top style='width:3.2in;border:solid windowtext 1.0pt;
  mso-border-alt:solid windowtext .5pt;padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='line-height:normal'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
  normal'><span style='font-family:"Courier New"'>5<br>
  A....<br>
  ####.<br>
  <span class=GramE>..</span>B..<br>
  <span class=GramE>.#</span>###<br>
  C.DE.<br>
  2<br>
  A.<br>
  .B<br>
  2<br>
  A#<br>
  #B</span></b><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style='font-size:
  12.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'><br>
  </span></b><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style='mso-bidi-font-size:
  12.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>0</span></b><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
  normal'><span style='font-size:12.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'><o:p></o:p></span></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width=309 valign=top style='width:231.85pt;border:solid windowtext 1.0pt;
  border-left:none;mso-border-left-alt:solid windowtext .5pt;mso-border-alt:
  solid windowtext .5pt;padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><b
  style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style='font-family:"Courier New"'>Case
  <st1:time Hour="13" Minute="15" w:st="on">1: 15</st1:time> 1<br>
  Case 2: 2 2<br>
  Case 3: Impossible<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><b><span
  style='font-family:"Courier New"'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></b></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
</table>

<div style='mso-element:para-border-div;border:none;border-bottom:solid windowtext 1.0pt;
mso-border-bottom-alt:solid windowtext .75pt;padding:0in 0in 1.0pt 0in'>

<p class=MsoNormal style='tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt;
border:none;mso-border-bottom-alt:solid windowtext .75pt;padding:0in;
mso-padding-alt:0in 0in 1.0pt 0in'><span style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:
16.0pt;line-height:115%;font-family:Garamond'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

</div>

<p class=MsoNormal style='tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><span
style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:16.0pt;line-height:115%;font-family:
Arial'>Problem <span class=GramE>Setter :</span> <span class=SpellE>Sohel</span>
Hafiz<br>

.shape {behavior:url(#default#VML);}
</style>

<body lang=EN-US link=blue vlink=purple style='tab-interval:.5in'>

<div class=Section1>

<div align=center>

 <tr style='mso-yfti-irow:0;mso-yfti-firstrow:yes;mso-yfti-lastrow:yes;
  height:67.25pt'>
  <td width=97 valign=top style='width:73.05pt;border:solid windowtext 1.0pt;
  mso-border-alt:solid windowtext .25pt;background:#E6E6E6;padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt;
  height:67.25pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal align=center style='margin-bottom:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;

  normal'><span style='font-size:72.0pt;font-family:Arial'>H<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width=541 style='width:405.75pt;border:solid windowtext 1.0pt;border-left:
  none;mso-border-left-alt:solid windowtext .25pt;mso-border-alt:solid windowtext .25pt;

  style='font-size:36.0pt;font-family:Impact;mso-bidi-font-family:Arial'>Hyper
  Prefix Sets<o:p></o:p></span></p>
  <p class=MsoNormal align=center style='margin-bottom:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;
  text-align:center;line-height:normal;tab-stops:143.25pt'><span
  style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
</table>

</div>

<p class=ListParagraph style='tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><span
style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:16.0pt;line-height:115%;font-family:
Garamond'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><span
style='font-size:12.0pt;line-height:115%;font-family:"Times New Roman"'>Prefix
goodness of a set string is length of longest common prefix*number of strings
in the set. For example the prefix goodness of the set {000<span class=GramE>,001,0011</span>}
is 6.You are given a set of binary strings. Find the maximum prefix goodness
among all possible subsets of these binary strings. <o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><b><span
style='font-size:16.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;line-height:115%;font-family:
Arial'>Input<br>
</span></b><span style='font-size:12.0pt;line-height:115%;font-family:"Times New Roman"'>First
line of the input contains <span class=GramE>T(</span>&#8804;20) the number of
test cases. Each of the test cases start with <span class=GramE>n(</span>&#8804;50000)
the number of strings. Each of the next n lines contains a string containing
only 0 and 1. Maximum length of each of <span class=GramE>these string</span>
is 200.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><b><span
style='font-size:16.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;line-height:115%;font-family:
Arial'>Output</span></b><span style='font-size:12.0pt;line-height:115%;
font-family:"Times New Roman"'><br>
For each test case output the maximum prefix goodness among all possible
subsets of n binary strings.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<h1 align=left style='text-align:left;tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><b><span
style='font-size:16.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;font-style:
normal'>Sample Input<span style='mso-spacerun:yes'>       </span><span
style='mso-spacerun:yes'>                      </span>Output for Sample Input<o:p></o:p></span></b></h1>

  border-left:none;mso-border-left-alt:solid windowtext .5pt;mso-border-alt:
  solid windowtext .5pt;padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
  <p class=HTMLPreformatted><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span
  lang=EN style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-ansi-language:EN'>6<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>
  <p class=HTMLPreformatted><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span
  lang=EN style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-ansi-language:EN'>20<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>
  <p class=HTMLPreformatted><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span
  lang=EN style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-ansi-language:EN'>66<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><b
  style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style='font-family:"Courier New"'>44</span></b></p>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
</table>

<div class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center;tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'>

<hr size=2 width="100%" align=center>

</div>

<!--[if gte mso 10]>

 /* Style Definitions */

	mso-bidi-language:#0400;}

 <o:shapelayout v:ext="edit">
  <o:idmap v:ext="edit" data="1"/>
 </o:shapelayout></xml><![endif]-->
</head>

<body lang=EN-US link=blue vlink=purple style='tab-interval:.5in'>

<div class=Section1>

<div align=center>

<table class=MsoNormalTable border=1 cellspacing=0 cellpadding=0
 style='border-collapse:collapse;mso-table-layout-alt:fixed;border:none;
 mso-border-alt:solid windowtext .25pt;mso-yfti-tbllook:480;mso-padding-alt:
 0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt;mso-border-insideh:.25pt solid windowtext;mso-border-insidev:
 .25pt solid windowtext'>
 <tr style='mso-yfti-irow:0;mso-yfti-firstrow:yes;mso-yfti-lastrow:yes;
  height:67.25pt'>
  <td width=97 valign=top style='width:73.1pt;border:solid windowtext 1.0pt;
  mso-border-alt:solid windowtext .25pt;background:#E6E6E6;padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt;
  height:67.25pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal align=center style='margin-bottom:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;
  text-align:center;line-height:normal;tab-stops:143.25pt'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
  normal'><span style='font-size:72.0pt;font-family:Arial'>I<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width=544 style='width:407.8pt;border:solid windowtext 1.0pt;border-left:
  none;mso-border-left-alt:solid windowtext .25pt;mso-border-alt:solid windowtext .25pt;
  padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt;height:67.25pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal align=center style='margin-bottom:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;
  text-align:center;line-height:normal;tab-stops:143.25pt'><span
  style='font-size:36.0pt;font-family:Impact;mso-bidi-font-family:Arial'>Integer
  Game<o:p></o:p></span></p>
  <p class=MsoNormal align=center style='margin-bottom:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;
  text-align:center;line-height:normal;tab-stops:143.25pt'><span
  style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
</table>

</div>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;line-height:normal'><span
style='font-size:12.0pt;font-family:"Times New Roman";mso-bidi-font-weight:
bold'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;line-height:normal'><span
style='font-size:12.0pt;font-family:"Times New Roman";mso-bidi-font-weight:
bold'>Two players, <b>S</b> and <b>T,</b> are playing a game where they make
alternate moves. <b>S</b> plays first. <br>
In this game, they start with an integer <b>N</b>. In each move, a player removes
one digit from the integer and passes the resulting number to the other player.
The game continues in this fashion until a player finds he/she has no digit to
remove when that player is declared as the loser.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;line-height:normal'><span
style='font-size:12.0pt;font-family:"Times New Roman";mso-bidi-font-weight:
bold'>With this restriction, its obvious that if the number of digits in <b>N</b>
is odd then <b>S</b> wins otherwise <b>T</b> wins. To make the game more
interesting, we apply one additional constraint. A player can remove a
particular digit if the sum of digits of the resulting number is a multiple of
3 or there are no digits left. <o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;line-height:normal'><span
style='font-size:12.0pt;font-family:"Times New Roman";mso-bidi-font-weight:
bold'>Suppose <b>N</b> = 1234. <b>S</b> has 4 possible moves. That is, he can
remove 1, 2, 3, or 4.<span style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>Of these, two of
them are valid moves.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;line-height:normal'><span
style='font-size:12.0pt;font-family:"Times New Roman";mso-bidi-font-weight:
bold'>- Removal of 4 results in 123 and the sum of digits = 1 + 2 + 3 = 6; 6 is
a multiple of 3.<br>
- Removal of 1 results in 234 and the sum of digits = 2 + 3 + 4 = 9; 9 is a
multiple of 3.<br>
The other two moves are invalid. <o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;line-height:normal'><span
style='font-size:12.0pt;font-family:"Times New Roman";mso-bidi-font-weight:
bold'>If both players play perfectly, who wins?<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><b><span style='font-size:16.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;
line-height:115%;font-family:"Times New Roman"'>Input<br>
</span></b><span style='font-size:12.0pt;line-height:115%;font-family:"Times New Roman"'>The
first line of input is an integer <span class=GramE><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'>T</b>(</span><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>T</b>&lt;60) that
determines the number of test cases. Each case is a line that contains a
positive integer <b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>N</b>. <b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>N</b> has at most 1000 digits and does not
contain any zeros.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><b><span style='font-size:16.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;
line-height:115%;font-family:"Times New Roman"'>Output<br>
</span></b><span style='font-size:12.0pt;line-height:115%;font-family:"Times New Roman"'>For
each <span class=GramE>case,</span> output the case number starting from 1. <span
class=GramE>If <b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>S</b> wins then output <b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>S</b> otherwise output <b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>T</b>.</span><o:p></o:p></span></p>

<h1 align=left style='text-align:left'><b><span style='font-size:16.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-style:normal'>Sample Input</span></b><b><span
style='font-size:16.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;font-style:
normal'><span style='mso-spacerun:yes'>     </span><span
style='mso-spacerun:yes'>                        </span></span></b><b><span
style='font-size:16.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-style:normal'>Output for
Sample Input</span></b><b><span style='font-size:16.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:
10.0pt;font-family:Arial;font-style:normal'><o:p></o:p></span></b></h1>

<table class=MsoNormalTable border=1 cellspacing=0 cellpadding=0
 style='background:#CCCCCC;border-collapse:collapse;border:none;mso-border-alt:
 solid windowtext .5pt;mso-padding-alt:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
 <tr style='mso-yfti-irow:0;mso-yfti-firstrow:yes;mso-yfti-lastrow:yes'>
  <td width=294 valign=top style='width:220.6pt;border:solid windowtext 1.0pt;
  mso-border-alt:solid windowtext .5pt;padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='line-height:normal'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
  normal'><span style='font-size:12.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>3<br>
  4<br>
  33<br>
  771<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width=296 valign=top style='width:222.2pt;border:solid windowtext 1.0pt;
  border-left:none;mso-border-left-alt:solid windowtext .5pt;mso-border-alt:
  solid windowtext .5pt;padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><b><span
  style='font-family:"Courier New"'>Case 1: S<br>
  Case 2: T<br>
  Case 3: T<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
</table>

<div class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center;tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'>

<hr size=2 width="100%" align=center>

</div>

<p class=MsoNormal><span style='font-size:12.0pt;line-height:115%;font-family:
Arial'>Problem Setter: <span class=SpellE>Sohel</span> Hafiz<br>
Special Thanks: <st1:place w:st="on"><st1:City w:st="on"><span class=SpellE>Shamim</span>
  Hafiz</st1:City>, <st1:State w:st="on">Md.</st1:State></st1:place> <span
class=SpellE>Arifuzzaman</span> <span class=SpellE>Arif</span></span></p>

11490||||||false||||||
<html>

<head>
<meta http-equiv=Content-Type content="text/html; charset=windows-1252">
<meta name=Generator content="Microsoft Word 11 (filtered)">
<title>Problem J - Just Another Problem</title>
<style>
<!--
 /* Font Definitions */
 @font-face
	{font-family:"Arial Unicode MS";
	panose-1:2 11 6 4 2 2 2 2 2 4;}
@font-face
	{font-family:Impact;
	panose-1:2 11 8 6 3 9 2 5 2 4;}
@font-face
	{font-family:"\@Arial Unicode MS";
	panose-1:2 11 6 4 2 2 2 2 2 4;}
 /* Style Definitions */
 p.MsoNormal, li.MsoNormal, div.MsoNormal
	{margin:0in;
	margin-bottom:.0001pt;
	font-size:12.0pt;
	font-family:"Times New Roman";
	color:black;}
h1
	{margin:0in;
	margin-bottom:.0001pt;
	text-align:justify;
	font-size:12.0pt;
	font-family:"Times New Roman";
	color:black;
	font-weight:normal;
	font-style:italic;}
h4
	{margin:0in;
	margin-bottom:.0001pt;
	page-break-after:avoid;
	font-size:12.0pt;
	font-family:"Times New Roman";
	color:black;
	font-weight:normal;}
h5
	{margin:0in;
	margin-bottom:.0001pt;
	page-break-after:avoid;
	font-size:12.0pt;
	font-family:"Times New Roman";
	color:black;
	font-weight:normal;}
span.StyleArial16pt
	{font-family:Arial;
	font-weight:bold;}
@page Section1
	{size:595.45pt 841.7pt;
	margin:.8in .8in 67.7pt .8in;}
div.Section1
	{page:Section1;}
 /* List Definitions */
 ol
	{margin-bottom:0in;}
ul
	{margin-bottom:0in;}
-->
</style>

</head>

<body lang=EN-US>

<div class=Section1>

<div align=center>

<table class=MsoNormalTable border=1 cellspacing=0 cellpadding=0
 style='border-collapse:collapse;border:none'>
 <tr style='height:67.25pt'>
  <td width=97 valign=top style='width:73.1pt;border:solid windowtext 1.0pt;
  background:#E6E6E6;padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt;height:67.25pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b><span
  style='font-size:72.0pt;font-family:Arial'>J</span></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width=544 style='width:407.8pt;border:solid windowtext 1.0pt;border-left:
  none;padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt;height:67.25pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><span
  style='font-size:36.0pt;font-family:Impact'>Just Another Problem</span></p>
  <p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><span
  style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial'>&nbsp;</span></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
</table>

</div>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'>&nbsp;</p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><img width=305 height=210
src="http://uva.onlinejudge.org/external/114/p11490a.jpg"  align=left hspace=12>There is a wise saying Nothing
is unfair in love and war. Probably that is why emperors of ancient days used
to use many funny and clever tricks to fool the opponents. The most common
technique was to scare the opponent away by out numbering them with imaginary
soldiers. One of the funnier tricks (though hard to believe) was to give the
own soldiers (not the opponent soldiers!) mild laxative dose so that there is a
long queue of soldiers in front of toilet. Seeing this queue from a distance
the opponent would miscalculate the total number of soldiers and flee away.
This was a famous trick given by famous clown of the sub-continent named Gopal
(The infamous Gopal Bhar to be precise). Another most common trick was to
have square shaped holes while arranging the soldiers in rows and columns. Such
an arrangement is shown below with 96 soldiers.</p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'>&nbsp;</p>

<div align=center>

<table class=MsoNormalTable border=1 cellspacing=0 cellpadding=0
 style='border-collapse:collapse;border:none'>
 <tr>
  <td width=511 valign=top style='width:383.4pt;border:solid windowtext 1.0pt;
  padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><img width=474 height=281
  src="http://uva.onlinejudge.org/external/114/p11490a.jpg" ><br clear=ALL>
  </p>
  </td>
 </tr>
 <tr>
  <td width=511 valign=top style='width:383.4pt;border:solid windowtext 1.0pt;
  border-top:none;padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'>Fig: A valid layout with 96
  soldiers. After arranging them 8 soldiers are missing.</p>
  </td>
 </tr>
</table>

</div>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'>&nbsp;</p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'>The strict property of such
arrangement for this problem is as follows:</p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'>&nbsp;</p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.25in'>(a)<span
style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; </span>The soldiers
have to be arranged in rows and columns.</p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.25in'>(b)<span
style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'>&nbsp;&nbsp; </span>The border of the
arrangement has to be rectangular. </p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.25in'>(c)<span
style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; </span>The arrangement
should have soldiers missing only from the inner layers.</p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.25in'>(d)<span
style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'>&nbsp;&nbsp; </span>The soldiers should be
missing only from two equal square shaped regions. So the number of missing
soldiers should be twice of a strictly positive square number. In the figure
above the number of missing soldier is 2*2<sup>2</sup>.</p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-left:.5in;text-align:justify;text-indent:-.25in'>(e)<span
style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; </span>The thickness of
soldiers should be equal every where (except the corners) in horizontal and
vertical directions along the missing square. For example in the figure above
the thickness of soldiers in horizontal and vertical directions along the
missing square is always three.  </p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'>&nbsp;</p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'>Now given the total number of
soldiers S your job is to determine whether or not they can be arranged
according to the above mentioned rules.</p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'>&nbsp;</p>

<h5 style='text-align:justify'><span class=StyleArial16pt><span
style='font-size:16.0pt'>Input</span></span></h5>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'>The input file contains 1000
lines of inputs. Each line contains a positive integer S (S&lt;1000000000000),
where S is the total number of soldiers.</p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'>&nbsp;</p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'>Input is terminated by line
containing a single zero.</p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'>&nbsp;</p>

<h4><span class=StyleArial16pt><span style='font-size:16.0pt'>Output </span></span></h4>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'>For each line of input produce
one or more line of output. Each line reports one possible number of possible
missing soldiers which would enable the desired arrange with the S soldiers. As
the number of possible missing soldiers can be quite large so instead of the
actual number, the modulo 100000007 value should be printed. Also if there is
more than one possible value for number of missing soldiers the modulo
100000007 values should be reported in descending order of the original number
of soldier (Not the modulo value). If no such number of missing soldiers is
found print the line No Solution Possible instead.</p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'>&nbsp;</p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'>Print a blank line after the
output for each line of input. Look at the output for sample input for details.</p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'>&nbsp;</p>

<h1 align=left style='text-align:left'><b><span style='font-size:16.0pt;
font-family:Arial;font-style:normal'>Sample Input                              
Output for Sample Input</span></b></h1>

<table class=MsoNormalTable border=1 cellspacing=0 cellpadding=0
 style='background:#CCCCCC;border-collapse:collapse;border:none'>
 <tr>
  <td width=307 valign=top style='width:3.2in;border:solid windowtext 1.0pt;
  padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal><b><span style='font-size:11.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>96</span></b></p>
  <p class=MsoNormal><b><span style='font-size:11.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>102</span></b></p>
  <p class=MsoNormal><b><span style='font-size:11.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>11100</span></b></p>
  <p class=MsoNormal><b><span style='font-size:11.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>0</span></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width=336 valign=top style='width:3.5in;border:solid windowtext 1.0pt;
  border-left:none;padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal><b><span style='font-size:11.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>Possible
  Missing Soldiers = 8</span></b></p>
  <p class=MsoNormal><b><span style='font-size:11.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>&nbsp;</span></b></p>
  <p class=MsoNormal><b><span style='font-size:11.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>No
  Solution Possible</span></b></p>
  <p class=MsoNormal><b><span style='font-size:11.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>&nbsp;</span></b></p>
  <p class=MsoNormal><b><span style='font-size:11.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>Possible
  Missing Soldiers = 553352</span></b></p>
  <p class=MsoNormal><b><span style='font-size:11.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>Possible
  Missing Soldiers = 308898</span></b></p>
  <p class=MsoNormal><b><span style='font-size:11.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>Possible
  Missing Soldiers = 45000</span></b></p>
  <p class=MsoNormal><b><span style='font-size:11.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>Possible
  Missing Soldiers = 3528</span></b></p>
  <p class=MsoNormal><b><span style='font-size:11.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>&nbsp;</span></b></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
</table>

<div class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'>

<hr size=2 width="100%" align=center>

</div>

<p class=MsoNormal><span style='font-family:Arial'>Problem Setter: Shahriar
Manzoor</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><span style='font-family:Arial'>Special Thanks: Syed Monowar
Hossain.</span></p>

11491||||||false||||||
<!DOCTYPE HTML PUBLIC "-//IETF//DTD HTML 2.0//EN">
<!--Converted with LaTeX2HTML 96.1 (Feb 5, 1996) by Nikos Drakos (nikos@cbl.leeds.ac.uk), CBLU, University of Leeds -->
<HTML>
<HEAD>
<TITLE>Erasing and Winning</TITLE>
</HEAD>
<BODY LANG="EN" BGCOLOR=#FFFFFF>
 <H1><BR CLEAR=ALL><CENTER><TABLE BGCOLOR=#0060F0><TR><TD><B><FONT SIZE=5 COLOR=#C0FFFF>&nbsp;Erasing and Winning</FONT>&nbsp;</B></TABLE></CENTER></H1>
<P>

<H2><FONT COLOR=#0070E8>The Problem</FONT></H2>

<p>
Juliano is a fan of the TV show <i>Erasing and Winning</i>, where
participants are selected in a draw and receive money for taking part in the show.

<p>
In the show, the presenter writes a number of <i>N</i> digits in a
board. The participant must then erase exactly  <i>D</i> digits
from the number in the board; the number formed by the remaining
digits is the value of the money prize for the participant.

<!--
No programa, o apresentador escreve um nÃºmero de $N$ dÃ­gitos em uma
lousa. O participante entÃ£o deve apagar exatamente $D$ dÃ­gitos do
nÃºmero que estÃ¡ na lousa; o nÃºmero formado pelos dÃ­gitos que restaram
Ã© entÃ£o o prÃªmio do participante.-->

<p>
Juliano was at last selected to take part in the show, and
asked you to write a program that, given the number the presenter
wrote in the board, and the number of digits Juliano must erase, 
determines the highest value of the prize he can win.

<!--
Juliano finalmente foi selecionado para participar do programa, e
pediu que vocÃª escrevesse um programa que, dados o nÃºmero que o
apresentador escreveu na lousa, e quantos dÃ­gitos Juliano tem que
apagar, determina o valor do maior prÃªmio que Juliano pode ganhar.
-->

<H2><FONT COLOR=#0070E8>The Input</FONT></H2>

<p>
The input contains several test cases. The first line of a test case
contains two integers <i>N</i> and <i>D</i> (<i>1 &le; D < N &le;
10<sup>5</sup></i>) indicating respectively the number of digits of the number
the presenter wrote in the board and the number of digits that must be
erased.  The next line contains the number the presenter wrote; the number
does not start with a zero.

<p>
The end of input is indicated by a line containing only two
zeros, separated by a space.

<!--
A entrada contÃ©m vÃ¡rios casos de teste. A primeira linha de
cada caso de teste contÃ©m dois inteiros $N$ e $D$ ($1 \le D < N \le
100000$), indicando o nÃºmero de dÃ­gitos do nÃºmero que o apresentador
escreveu na lousa e quantos dÃ­gitos devem. A linha seguinte contÃ©m o
nÃºmero escrito pelo apresentador, que nÃ£o contÃ©m zeros Ã  esquerda.

O final da entrada Ã© indicado por uma linha contendo dois zeros.
-->

<H2><FONT COLOR=#0070E8>The Output</FONT></H2>


<p>
For each test case in the input your program must produce one single line
in the output, containing the highest prize Juliano can win.


<!--
Para cada caso de teste da entrada seu programa deve imprimir uma Ãºnica linha
na saÃ­da, contendo o maior prÃªmio que Juliano pode ganhar.
-->


<H2><FONT COLOR=#0070E8>Sample Input</FONT></H2>
<P>
<PRE>
4 2
3759
6 3
123123
7 4
1000000
0 0
</PRE>
<P>
<H2><FONT COLOR=#0070E8>Sample Output</FONT></H2>
<P>
<PRE>
79
323
100
</PRE>
</BODY>
</HTML>

______________________________________________________
11492||||||false||||||
<!DOCTYPE HTML PUBLIC "-//IETF//DTD HTML 2.0//EN">
<HTML>
<HEAD>
<TITLE>Babel</TITLE>
</HEAD>
<BODY LANG="EN" BGCOLOR=#FFFFFF>
 <H1><BR CLEAR=ALL><CENTER><TABLE BGCOLOR=#0060F0><TR><TD><B><FONT SIZE=5 COLOR=#C0FFFF>&nbsp;Babel</FONT>&nbsp;</B></TABLE></CENTER></H1>
<P>

<H2><FONT COLOR=#0070E8>The Problem</FONT></H2>

<p>
John and Mary are brothers, and are enthusiastic about their courses on foreign languages.
Each of the brothers is taking several language courses. When they get home they comment
on grammar, vocabulary, culture of the different countries and so on. In one of those
conversations they realized some words are common to more than one language, even though
the words may have different meanings in the languages. For example, the word "amigo" exists in Portuguese
and Spanish and has the same meaning, while "date" is a word that exists in English and
French and may have different meanings, since "date" is also a fruit, besides meaning
a calendar date. On the other hand, "red" in Spanish is a network, while in English it is
a color.

<!--
Joãozinho e Mariazinha são dois irmãos que estão muito empolgados com suas aulas de idiomas,
cada um está fazendo vários diferentes cursinhos.
Ao chegar em casa comentam sobre gramática, vocabulário, cultura dos países 
etc. Numa dessas conversas perceberam que algumas palavras são comuns a
mais de um idioma, mesmo que não necessariamente tenham o mesmo significado.
Por exemplo, ``amigo'' existe em português e espanhol e têm o mesmo significado,
enquanto enquanto que ``date'' é uma palavra comum entre francês e inglês mas
que pode ter significados diferentes, uma vez que ``date'' também se refere
a um encontro em inglês, além de ``data'' de calendário. Já ``red'' em espanhol
se refere a uma rede, enquanto que em inglês se refere à cor vermelha. Outro exemplo
seria ``actual'' que, em inglês significa algo real e, em espanhol, tem o significado
de presente, atual (como em português).
-->
<p>
Thrilled by these findings, the brothers decided to write in a notepad
all words in common they could think of, associating each word to a
pair of languages. Observant and smart, John proposed a challenge to
Mary: given one language to start and one language to finish, write
down a sequence of words such that the first word is included in the
vocabulary of the start language, and the last word is included in
the vocabulary of the finish language. Two adjacent words in the
sequence must be in the vocabulary of the same language.  For example,
if the start language is Portuguese and the finish language is French,
Mary could write the sequence "amigo actual date" (Portuguese/Spanish,
Spanish/English, English/French).

<!--
Empolgados com essas descobertas, resolveram escrever num caderno todas as
palavras em comum que conseguiram pensar, associando cada uma a um par de
idiomas. Observador como é, Joãozinho propôs um desafio a Mariazinha: dados
um idioma de origem e um de destino, escrever uma série de palavras sendo que
a primeira necessariamente deveria pertencer ao idioma de origem e a última
ao de destino. Duas palavras adjacentes nessa seqüência deveriam necessariamente
pertencer a um mesmo idioma. Por exemplo, se o idioma de origem fosse português
e o de destino francês, Mariazinha poderia escrever a seqüência 
\texttt{amigo actual date} (português/espanhol, espanhol/inglês, inglês/francês).
-->

<p>
To John's surprise, Mary solved the problem rather easily. Annoyed by his
sister's success, he decided to make the problem more difficult: Mary must find
a solution in which the sequence has the smallest number of letters in total (not counting spaces
between words), and, besides, two consecutive words must not have the same initial letter.

<!--
Para a surpresa de Joãozinho, Mariazinha conseguiu resolver o problema com
muita facilidade. Irritado com o sucesso de sua irmã, ele resolveu complicar ainda
mais o problema: Mariazinha deve encontrar a solução que tenha o menor número de
letras no total (sem contar os espaços entre as palavras) e, além disso, duas
palavras consecutivas não podem ter a mesma letra inicial.
-->

<p>
Note that the previous solution is now invalid, as "amigo" and "actual" share the
same initial letter. It is possible, however, to find another solution, "amigo red date",
with a total length equal to 12.

<!--
Sendo assim, a solução anterior passa a ser inválida, pois ``amigo'' e ``actual''
têm a mesma letra inicial. É possível, porém, encontrar outra solução, que
no caso seria \texttt{amigo red date}, cujo comprimento total é $12$.
-->

<p>
John did an extensive research on the Internet and compiled an enormous list of
words, and challenged Mary to solve the problem. As there may be more than one
solution, he asked her to answer if there is a solution, and in that case to
answer the number of letters in the best solution. Can you help Mary?

<!--
Joãozinho fez uma extensa pesquisa na internet e compilou uma enorme lista de palavras
e desafiou Mariazinha a resolver o desafio. Como é possível que haja mais de uma
solução, ele pediu para que ela apenas respondesse a quantidade de letras da
melhor solução dadas as restrições ou se não há solução possível. Você seria capaz de ajudar Mariazinha?
-->
<H2><FONT COLOR=#0070E8>The Input</FONT></H2>

<p>
The input contains several test cases. The first line of a test case
contains one integer <i>M</i> (<i>1 &le; M &le; 2000</i>),
representing the total number of words compiled by John. 
The second line contains two distinct strings <i>O</i> and <i>D</i>,
separated by one space, indicating respectively the start language and
the finish language.
Each of the
next <i>M</i> lines contains three strings <i>I<sub>1</sub>, I<sub>2</sub></i> and <i>P</i>,
separated by one space, representing respectively two languages and
one word in common between both languages (<i>I<sub>1</sub></i> and <i>I<sub>2</sub></i> are
always distinct). All strings will have length
at least 1 and at most 50, and will be composed of lower case
letters only. The same pair of languages may have several words associated
to it, but a word <i>P</i> will be never repeated in a test case.

<p>The end of input is indicated by a line containing
only one zero.

<!--

A entrada contém vários casos de teste.
A primeira linha de um caso de teste contém um inteiro $M$ ($1 \leq M \leq 2000$),
representando o total de palavras compiladas por Joãozinho. A segunda linha contém
duas cadeias de caracteres distintas $O$ e $D$, separadas por um espaço em branco,
indicando os idiomas de origem e destino respectivamente. Cada uma das $M$ linhas seguintes
contém três cadeias de caracteres $I_1$, $I_2$ e $P$, separadas por um espaço em branco, representando
dois idiomas e uma palavra comum entre ambos ($I_1$ e $I_2$ são sempre diferentes). 
Todas as cadeias de caracteres terão tamanho mínimo $1$
e máximo $50$ e conterão apenas letras minúsculas. Repare que uma mesma palavra pode aparecer
para mais de um par de idiomas, assim como um mesmo par pode ter várias palavras associadas
a ele. Repare, também, que se uma mesma palavra $P$ for associada a dois pares de idiomas $I_1$/
$I_2$ e $I_2$/$I_3$ então, por transitividade, também estará associada ao par $I_1$/$I_3$.

-->

<H2><FONT COLOR=#0070E8>The Output</FONT></H2>

<p>
For each test case in the input, your program must print a line with a single integer,
the length of the shortest sequence that satisfies John's restrictions, or the word
"<font face="courier">impossivel</font>" (lowercase, meaning
"impossible" in Portuguese) in case it is not possible.

<!--
Para cada caso de teste da entrada seu programa deve imprimir um único
inteiro, o comprimento da menor seqüência que satisfaça as restrições de Joãozinho, ou \texttt{-1}
caso não seja possível.
-->

<H2><FONT COLOR=#0070E8>Sample Input</FONT></H2>
<P>
<PRE>
4
portugues frances
ingles espanhol red
espanhol portugues amigo
frances ingles date
espanhol ingles actual
4
portugues alemao
ingles espanhol red
espanhol portugues amigo
frances ingles date
espanhol ingles actual
6
portugues frances
ingles espanhol red
espanhol portugues amigo
frances ingles date
frances espanhol la
portugues ingles a
espanhol ingles actual
0
</PRE>
<P>
<H2><FONT COLOR=#0070E8>Sample Output</FONT></H2>
<P>
<PRE>
12
impossivel
5
</PRE>
</BODY>
</HTML>

______________________________________________________
11493||||||false||||||
<!DOCTYPE HTML PUBLIC "-//IETF//DTD HTML 2.0//EN">
<HTML>
<HEAD>
<TITLE>The Club Ballroom</TITLE>
</HEAD>
<BODY LANG="EN" BGCOLOR=#FFFFFF>
 <H1><BR CLEAR=ALL><CENTER><TABLE BGCOLOR=#0060F0><TR><TD><B><FONT SIZE=5 COLOR=#C0FFFF>&nbsp;The Club Ballroom</FONT>&nbsp;</B></TABLE></CENTER></H1>
<P>

<H2><FONT COLOR=#0070E8>The Problem</FONT></H2>

<p>
The Tingua Social Club is building its new ballroom. The club members
wish to have the floor covered with wood planks, as they consider
this to be the best for dancing. A lumberyard from the region
donated a large quantity of good quality wooden planks to be used
in the ballroom. The donated planks have all the same width, but
have different lengths. 

<!--
O Clube Recreativo de TinguÃ¡ estÃ¡ construindo a sua nova sede
social. Os sÃ³cios desejam que o piso do salÃ£o da sede seja de tÃ¡buas de
madeira, pois consideram que este Ã© o melhor tipo de piso para os
famosos bailes do clube. Uma madeireira da regiÃ£o doou uma grande
quantidade de tÃ¡buas de boa qualidade, para serem utilizadas no
piso. As tÃ¡buas doadas tÃªm todas a mesma largura, mas tÃªm
comprimentos distintos.
-->

<p>
The ballroom is a rectangle of dimensions <i>N x M</i> meters. The
planks must be placed juxtaposed, so that no plank superposes another,
and the whole floor must be covered. They must be aligned, lengthwise,
to one of the sides of the ballroom, and all planks must be parallel.
The club members do not want too many joints in the floor, and therefore 
if a plank is not long enough to cover the distance between two opposite
sides of the ballroom, it can be joined to at most one other plank to
complete the distance. Furthermore, the chief-carpenter has a great
respect for all woods, and would rather not saw any plank. Therefore,
he wants to know whether it is possible to cover the floor
with the set of planks donated, observing the restrictions described; in
case it is possible, the chief-carpenter wish to know the smallest
number of planks he can use.

<!--
O salÃ£o da sede social Ã© um retÃ¢ngulo de dimensÃµes $N \times M$
metros. As tÃ¡buas devem ser colocadas justapostas, sem que qualquer
parte de uma tÃ¡bua seja sobreposta a outra tÃ¡bua, e devem cobrir todo
o piso do salÃ£o. Elas devem ser dispostas alinhadas, no sentido do
comprimento, a um dos lados do retÃ¢ngulo, e todas devem estar no mesmo
sentido (ou seja, todas as tÃ¡buas devem estar paralelas, no sentido do
comprimento). AlÃ©m disso, os sÃ³cios nÃ£o querem muitas emendas no piso,
e portanto se uma tÃ¡bua nÃ£o Ã© longa o bastante para cobrir a distÃ£ncia
entre um lado e outro do salÃ£o, ela pode ser emendada a no mÃ¡ximo uma
outra tÃ¡bua para completar a distÃ¢ncia. Adicionalmente, o
carpinteiro-chefe tem um grande respeito por todas as madeiras e
prefere nÃ£o serrar qualquer tÃ¡bua. Assim, ele deseja saber se Ã©
possÃ­vel forrar todo o piso com as tÃ¡buas doadas, obedecendo Ã s
restriÃ§Ãµes especificadas; caso seja possÃ­vel, o carpinteiro-chefe
deseja ainda saber o menor nÃºmero de tÃ¡buas que serÃ¡ necessÃ¡rio
utilizar.
-->

<p>
The figure below depicts two possible ways to cover the floor of a
ballroom with dimensions <i>4 x 5</i> meters for a set of ten donated
planks, with 100 cm width, and lengths 1, 2, 2, 2, 2, 3, 3, 4, 4 and 5 meters.

<center>
<img src="http://uva.onlinejudge.org/external/114/p11493.png" >
</center>
<!--
A figura abaixo ilustra duas possÃ­veis maneiras de forrar o piso de um
salÃ£o com dimensÃµes 4 $\times$ 5 metros para um conjunto de dez tÃ¡buas
doadas, com 100 cm de largura, e comprimentos
1, 2, 2, 2, 2, 3, 3, 4, 4, 5.

\begin{center}
\epsfig{file=clube_fig.eps}
\end{center}
-->

<H2><FONT COLOR=#0070E8>The Input</FONT></H2>

<p>
The input contains several test cases. The first line of a test case
contains two integers <i>N</i> and <i>M</i> indicating the dimensions,
in meters, of the ballroom (<i>1 &le; N,M &le; 10<sup>4</sup></i>).  The
second line contains one integer <i>L</i> representing the planks
width, in centimeters (<i>1 &le; L &le; 100</i>).  The third line
contains one integer <i>K</i>, indicating the number of planks donated
(<i>1 &le; K &le; 10<sup>5</sup></i>). The fourth line contains <i>K</i>
integers <i>X<sub>i</sub></i>, separated by spaces, representing the length, in
meters, of one plank (<i>1 &le; X<sub>i</sub> &le; 10<sup>4</sup></i>
for <i>1 &le; i &le; K</i>). The end of input is indicated by a line containing
only two zeros, separated by one space.

<!--
A entrada contÃ©m vÃ¡rios casos de teste.  A primeira linha de um caso
de teste contÃ©m dois inteiros <i>N<i> e <i>M<i> indicando as dimensÃµes, em
metros, do salÃ£o (<i>1 &le; N,M &le; 10<sup>4</sup><i>). A segunda linha contÃ©m um
inteiro <i>L<i>, representando a largura das tÃ¡buas, em centÃ­metros
(<i>1 &le; L &le; 100<i>). A terceira linha contÃ©m um inteiro, <i>K<i>,
indicando o nÃºmero de tÃ¡buas doadas (<i>1 &le; K &le; 10<sup>5</sup><i>). A quarta
linha contÃ©m <i>K<i> inteiros <i>X_i<i>, separados por um espaÃ§o, cada um
representando o comprimento, em metros, de uma tÃ¡bua (<i>1 &le; X_i &le;
10^4<i> para <i>1<i<K<i>). O final da entrada Ã© indicado por uma linha que
contÃ©m apenas dois nÃºmeros zero, separados por um espaÃ§o.
-->

<H2><FONT COLOR=#0070E8>The Output</FONT></H2>
<p>
For each of the test cases in the input your program must print
one single line, containing one integer, the smallest number of
planks needed to cover the whole floor, satisfying the restrictions
established. If it is not possible to cover the whole floor satisfying the restrictions
established, print one line with the word "<font face=courier>impossivel</font>" (which means impossible in Portuguese).

<!--
Para cada um dos casos de teste da entrada seu programa deve imprimir
uma Ãºnica linha, contendo o menor nÃºmero de tÃ¡buas necessÃ¡rio para
cobrir todo o piso do salÃ£o, obedecendo as restriÃ§Ãµes estabelecidas.
Caso nÃ£o seja possÃ­vel cobrir todo o piso do salÃ£o obedecendo as
restriÃ§Ãµes estabelecidas, imprima uma linha com a palavra
`\texttt{impossivel}' (note a ausÃªncia de acento).
-->

<H2><FONT COLOR=#0070E8>Sample Input</FONT></H2>
<P>
<PRE>
4 5
100
10
1 2 2 2 2 3 3 4 4 5
5 4
100
7
4 5 4 4 4 4 3
4 5
99
4
4 4 4 4
3 2
100
7
2 4 1 4 2 4 4
0 0
</PRE>
<P>
<H2><FONT COLOR=#0070E8>Sample Output</FONT></H2>
<P>
<PRE>
7
5
impossivel
impossivel
</PRE>
</BODY>
</HTML>
