<body bgcolor=white lang=EN-US link="#6633CC" vlink=purple style='tab-interval:
.5in'>

<div class=Section1>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b><span
style='font-size:20.0pt;font-family:Arial'>Problem C</span></b><span
style='font-family:Arial'><br>
</span><b><span style='font-size:20.0pt;font-family:Arial'>Sultan's Chandelier </span></b><span
style='font-family:Arial'><br>
<b>Input: </b>Standard Input</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b><span
style='font-family:Arial'>Output: </span></b><span style='font-family:Arial'>Standard
Output </span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'>&nbsp;</p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'>Once upon a time, there was a
sultan, who built a huge palace for the one he loves. To show his affection,
every thing from wall paints and paintings were chosen by him. Since our Sultan
has a weird type of taste, the chandeliers in this palace looked like trees.</p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'>The chandeliers take a tree like
structure. Each node of the tree has a colored light, and all <span
class=GramE>it's</span> children are placed equally spaced around it in
clockwise direction. The child sub trees can be rotated around the node. Thus, <span
class=GramE>One</span> chandelier, can be rotated to look like another
chandelier. </p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'>The sultan wants to know, given
the basic structure of the chandelier, and the number of colored lights, how
many different chandeliers can be created.</p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'>For example, for a tree like the
following:</p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'>&nbsp;<!--[if gte vml 1]><v:shapetype
 id="_x0000_t75" coordsize="21600,21600" o:spt="75" o:preferrelative="t"
 path="m@4@5l@4@11@9@11@9@5xe" filled="f" stroked="f">
 <v:stroke joinstyle="miter"/>
 <v:formulas>
  <v:f eqn="if lineDrawn pixelLineWidth 0"/>
  <v:f eqn="sum @0 1 0"/>
  <v:f eqn="sum 0 0 @1"/>
  <v:f eqn="prod @2 1 2"/>
  <v:f eqn="prod @3 21600 pixelWidth"/>
  <v:f eqn="prod @3 21600 pixelHeight"/>
  <v:f eqn="sum @0 0 1"/>
  <v:f eqn="prod @6 1 2"/>
  <v:f eqn="prod @7 21600 pixelWidth"/>
  <v:f eqn="sum @8 21600 0"/>
  <v:f eqn="prod @7 21600 pixelHeight"/>
  <v:f eqn="sum @10 21600 0"/>
 </v:formulas>
 <v:path o:extrusionok="f" gradientshapeok="t" o:connecttype="rect"/>
 <o:lock v:ext="edit" aspectratio="t"/>
</v:shapetype><v:shape id="_x0000_s1026" type="#_x0000_t75" alt="  style='position:absolute;
 left:0;text-align:left;margin-left:0;margin-top:0;width:248.25pt;height:99.75pt;
 z-index:1;mso-wrap-distance-left:0;mso-wrap-distance-right:0;
 mso-position-horizontal:left;mso-position-horizontal-relative:text;
 mso-position-vertical-relative:line' o:allowoverlap="f">
 <v:imagedata src="http://uva.onlinejudge.org/external/115/c_files/image001.jpg" />
 <w:wrap type="square"/>
</v:shape><![endif]--><![if !vml]><img width=331 height=133
src="http://uva.onlinejudge.org/external/115/c_files/image001.jpg"  align=left v:shapes="_x0000_s1026"><![endif]></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'>&nbsp;</p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'>&nbsp;</p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'>&nbsp;</p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'>&nbsp;</p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'>&nbsp;</p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'>&nbsp;</p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'>&nbsp;</p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><span class=GramE>if</span> the
available colours are red and green, then only these chandeliers can be made:</p>

<table class=MsoNormalTable border=0 cellspacing=0 cellpadding=0
 style='margin-left:2.75pt;border-collapse:collapse;mso-padding-alt:0in 0in 0in 0in'>
 <tr style='mso-yfti-irow:0;mso-yfti-firstrow:yes'>
  <td width=332 valign=top style='width:249.25pt;border:solid black 1.0pt;
  border-right:none;padding:2.75pt 2.75pt 2.75pt 2.75pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal><!--[if gte vml 1]><v:shape id="_x0000_s1027" type="#_x0000_t75"
   alt="  style='position:absolute;margin-left:0;margin-top:0;width:243.75pt;
   height:104.25pt;z-index:2;mso-wrap-distance-left:0;
   mso-wrap-distance-right:0;mso-position-horizontal:left;
   mso-position-vertical-relative:line' o:allowoverlap="f">
   <v:imagedata src="http://uva.onlinejudge.org/external/115/c_files/image001.jpg" />
   <w:wrap type="square"/>
  </v:shape><![endif]--><![if !vml]><img width=325 height=139
  src="http://uva.onlinejudge.org/external/115/c_files/image001.jpg"  align=left v:shapes="_x0000_s1027"><![endif]><span
  style='color:windowtext'><o:p></o:p></span></p>
  </td>
  <td width=333 valign=top style='width:249.65pt;border:solid black 1.0pt;
  padding:2.75pt 2.75pt 2.75pt 2.75pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal><!--[if gte vml 1]><v:shape id="_x0000_s1028" type="#_x0000_t75"
   alt="  style='position:absolute;margin-left:0;margin-top:0;width:243.75pt;

   mso-position-vertical-relative:line' o:allowoverlap="f">

  </v:shape><![endif]--><![if !vml]><img width=325 height=146

  </td>
 </tr>
 <tr style='mso-yfti-irow:1'>
  <td width=332 valign=top style='width:249.25pt;border-top:none;border-left:
  solid black 1.0pt;border-bottom:solid black 1.0pt;border-right:none;
  padding:2.75pt 2.75pt 2.75pt 2.75pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal><!--[if gte vml 1]><v:shape id="_x0000_s1029" type="#_x0000_t75"
   alt="  style='position:absolute;margin-left:0;margin-top:0;width:243.75pt;

  src="http://uva.onlinejudge.org/external/115/c_files/image001.jpg"  align=left v:shapes="_x0000_s1029"><![endif]><span
  style='color:windowtext'><o:p></o:p></span></p>
  </td>
  <td width=333 valign=top style='width:249.65pt;border:solid black 1.0pt;
  border-top:none;padding:2.75pt 2.75pt 2.75pt 2.75pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal><!--[if gte vml 1]><v:shape id="_x0000_s1030" type="#_x0000_t75"
   alt="  style='position:absolute;margin-left:0;margin-top:0;width:243.75pt;

   mso-position-horizontal:left;mso-position-horizontal-relative:text;
   mso-position-vertical-relative:line' o:allowoverlap="f">
   <v:imagedata src="http://uva.onlinejudge.org/external/115/c_files/image001.jpg" />
   <w:wrap type="square"/>
  </v:shape><![endif]--><![if !vml]><img width=325 height=146
  src="http://uva.onlinejudge.org/external/115/c_files/image001.jpg"  align=left v:shapes="_x0000_s1030"><![endif]><span

  </td>
 </tr>
 <tr style='mso-yfti-irow:2;mso-yfti-lastrow:yes'>
  <td width=332 valign=top style='width:249.25pt;border-top:none;border-left:
  solid black 1.0pt;border-bottom:solid black 1.0pt;border-right:none;
  padding:2.75pt 2.75pt 2.75pt 2.75pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal><!--[if gte vml 1]><v:shape id="_x0000_s1031" type="#_x0000_t75"
   alt="  style='position:absolute;margin-left:0;margin-top:0;width:243.75pt;
   height:116.25pt;z-index:6;mso-wrap-distance-left:0;

  </td>
  <td width=333 valign=top style='width:249.65pt;border:solid black 1.0pt;
  border-top:none;padding:2.75pt 2.75pt 2.75pt 2.75pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal><!--[if gte vml 1]><v:shape id="_x0000_s1032" type="#_x0000_t75"
   alt="  style='position:absolute;margin-left:0;margin-top:0;width:243.75pt;
   height:98.25pt;z-index:7;mso-wrap-distance-left:0;mso-wrap-distance-right:0;
   mso-position-horizontal:left;mso-position-horizontal-relative:text;
   mso-position-vertical-relative:line' o:allowoverlap="f">
   <v:imagedata src="http://uva.onlinejudge.org/external/115/c_files/image001.jpg" />
   <w:wrap type="square"/>
  </v:shape><![endif]--><![if !vml]><img width=325 height=131
  src="http://uva.onlinejudge.org/external/115/c_files/image001.jpg"  align=left v:shapes="_x0000_s1032"><![endif]><span
  style='color:windowtext'><o:p></o:p></span></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
</table>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'>&nbsp;</p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'>Given the tree structure and the
number of different lights, find the possible chandeliers that sultan can use.</p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'>&nbsp;</p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'>The tree is represented
recursively as the following:</p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'>&nbsp;</p>

<p class=MsoNormal><span style='font-family:"Courier 10 Pitch"'>&lt;<span
class=GramE>subtree</span>&gt; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; ::= '['
&lt;tree list&gt; ']' | '[ ]'</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><span style='font-family:"Courier 10 Pitch"'>&lt;tree
list&gt; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<span class=GramE>&nbsp; ::</span>=
&lt;subtree&gt; | &lt;subtree&gt; ',' &lt;tree list&gt;</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'>&nbsp;</p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'>The &lt;tree list&gt; lists the sub
trees rooted at the node. The tree drawn above can be represented using the
following string:</p>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><span
style='font-family:Arial'>[ [], [] ]</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><span class=stylearial16pt><span
style='font-size:16.0pt'>Input</span></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'>&nbsp;</p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'>Input will start with an integer <b>T
(<i>T &lt;= 4000)</i></b>, the number of test cases. Each of the following <b>T</b>
lines each will contain a string containing only of <span style='font-family:
"Courier 10 Pitch"'>'['</span>, <span style='font-family:"Courier 10 Pitch"'>','</span>
and <span style='font-family:"Courier 10 Pitch"'>']'</span>, describing the
tree, and an integer <b>C (<i>C &lt;= 100)</i></b>, the number of available
colours for the lights in the chandelier. <span class=GramE>number</span> of
nodes in the tree will be &lt;= 100.</p>

<p class=MsoNormal>&nbsp;</p>

<h4><span class=stylearial16pt><span style='font-size:16.0pt'>Output </span></span></h4>

<p class=MsoNormal>&nbsp;</p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'>For each test case, output the
case number, and the number of different chandelier sultan can have. Output the
number % 1000000007.</p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'>&nbsp;</p>

<h1 align=left style='text-align:left'><b><span style='font-size:16.0pt;
font-family:Arial;font-style:normal'>Sample
Input&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
Output for Sample Input</span></b></h1>

<table class=MsoNormalTable border=0 cellspacing=0 cellpadding=0
 style='margin-left:-.75pt;border-collapse:collapse;mso-padding-alt:0in 0in 0in 0in'>
 <tr style='mso-yfti-irow:0;mso-yfti-firstrow:yes;mso-yfti-lastrow:yes'>
  <td width=313 valign=top style='width:234.9pt;border:solid black 1.0pt;
  border-right:none;background:#CCCCCC;padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
  <p class=tablecontents style='layout-grid-mode:char'><span style='font-family:
  "Courier New"'>6 <o:p></o:p></span></p>
  <p class=tablecontents><span style='font-family:"Courier New"'>[[],[],[]] 2 <o:p></o:p></span></p>
  <p class=tablecontents><span style='font-family:"Courier New"'>[] 2 <o:p></o:p></span></p>
  <p class=tablecontents><span style='font-family:"Courier New"'>[[],[]] 2 <o:p></o:p></span></p>
  <p class=tablecontents><span style='font-family:"Courier New"'>[[[],[]],[],[[],[]]]
  2 <o:p></o:p></span></p>
  <p class=tablecontents><span style='font-family:"Courier New"'>[[[],[]],[],[],[[],[]]]
  4 <o:p></o:p></span></p>
  <p class=tablecontents><span style='font-family:"Courier New"'>[[[],[]],[],[[],[]],[]]
  4<o:p></o:p></span></p>
  </td>
  <td width=338 valign=top style='width:253.5pt;border:solid black 1.0pt;
  background:#CCCCCC;padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
  <p class=tablecontents style='layout-grid-mode:char'><span style='font-family:
  "Courier New"'>Case #1: 8 <o:p></o:p></span></p>
  <p class=tablecontents><span style='font-family:"Courier New"'>Case #2: 2 <o:p></o:p></span></p>
  <p class=tablecontents><span style='font-family:"Courier New"'>Case #3: 6 <o:p></o:p></span></p>
  <p class=tablecontents><span style='font-family:"Courier New"'>Case #4: 144 <o:p></o:p></span></p>
  <p class=tablecontents><span style='font-family:"Courier New"'>Case #5:
  102400 <o:p></o:p></span></p>
  <p class=tablecontents><span style='font-family:"Courier New"'>Case #6: 51520
  <o:p></o:p></span></p>
  </td>
 </tr>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'>&nbsp;</p>

double gray .75pt;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in'>

<body lang=EN-US link="#6633CC" vlink=purple style='tab-interval:.5in'>

<div class=Section1>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><span style='font-size:20.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:24.0pt;font-family:
Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:Arial'>Problem D</span></b><span style='font-family:
Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:Arial'><br>
</span><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style='font-size:20.0pt;
font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:Arial'>Decoding</span></b><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style='font-size:20.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:
24.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:Arial'> </span></b><span
style='font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:Arial'><br>
<b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>Input: </b><span style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
bold'>Standard Input<o:p></o:p></span></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><span style='font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:Arial'>Output: </span></b><span
style='font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'>Standard
Output <o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'>Encoding is the process of
transforming information from one format into another. There exist several
different types of encoding scheme. In this problem we will talk about a very simple
encoding technique; <i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>Run-Length Encoding</i>.</p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'>Run-length encoding is a very
simple and easy form of data compression in which consecutive occurrences of
the same characters are replaced by a single character followed by its
frequency. As an example, the string <b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span
style='font-family:"Courier New";mso-bidi-font-family:"Courier New"'>AABBBBDAA</span></b>
would be encoded to <b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span
style='font-family:"Courier New";mso-bidi-font-family:"Courier New"'>A2B4D1A2</span></b>,
quotes for clarity.</p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'>In this problem, we are
interested in decoding strings that were encoded using the above procedure.</p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><span class=StyleArial16pt><span
style='font-size:16.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>Input<o:p></o:p></span></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'>The first line of input is an
integer <span class=GramE><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>T</b>(</span><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>T</b>&lt;50) that indicates the number of test
cases. Each case is a line consisting of an encoded string. The string will
contain only digits [<span style='font-family:"Courier New";mso-bidi-font-family:
"Courier New"'>0-9</span>] and letters [<span style='font-family:"Courier New";
mso-bidi-font-family:"Courier New"'>A-Z</span>]. Every inputted string will be
valid. That is, every letter will be followed by 1 or more digits.</p>

<p class=MsoNormal><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p>

<h4 style='margin-left:0in;text-indent:0in;tab-stops:0in'><span
class=StyleArial16pt><span style='font-size:16.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>Output <o:p></o:p></span></span></h4>

<p class=MsoNormal><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'>For each case, output the case
number followed by the decoded string. Adhere to the sample for exact format. </p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'>You may assume the decoded string
wont have a length greater than 200 and it will only consist of upper case
alphabets.</p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;tab-stops:143.25pt'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p>

<h1 align=left style='margin-left:0in;text-align:left;text-indent:0in;
tab-stops:0in'><b><span style='font-size:16.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;
font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:Arial;font-style:normal'>Sample
Input<span style='mso-spacerun:yes'>                              </span>Output
for Sample Input<o:p></o:p></span></b></h1>

<table class=MsoNormalTable border=0 cellspacing=0 cellpadding=0
 style='margin-left:-1.25pt;border-collapse:collapse;mso-padding-alt:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
 <tr style='mso-yfti-irow:0;mso-yfti-firstrow:yes;mso-yfti-lastrow:yes'>
  <td width=313 valign=top style='width:234.9pt;border:solid black 1.0pt;
  border-right:none;mso-border-top-alt:solid black .5pt;mso-border-left-alt:
  solid black .5pt;mso-border-bottom-alt:solid black .5pt;background:#CCCCCC;
  padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='layout-grid-mode:char'><a name="DDE_LINK1"><span
  style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New";
  mso-bidi-font-family:"Courier New";mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'>3<o:p></o:p></span></a></p>
  <p class=MsoNormal><span style='mso-bookmark:DDE_LINK1'><span
  style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New";
  mso-bidi-font-family:"Courier New";mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'>A2B4D1A2<o:p></o:p></span></span></p>
  <p class=MsoNormal><span style='mso-bookmark:DDE_LINK1'><span
  style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New";
  mso-bidi-font-family:"Courier New";mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'>A12<o:p></o:p></span></span></p>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='layout-grid-mode:char;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric'><span
  style='mso-bookmark:DDE_LINK1'><span style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:
  12.0pt;font-family:"Courier New";mso-bidi-font-family:"Courier New";
  mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'>A1B1C1D1</span></span><span style='font-size:11.0pt;
  mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;font-family:"Courier New";mso-bidi-font-family:
  "Courier New";mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'><o:p></o:p></span></p>
  </td>
  <td width=339 valign=top style='width:254.5pt;border:solid black 1.0pt;
  mso-border-alt:solid black .5pt;background:#CCCCCC;padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='layout-grid-mode:char'><a name="DDE_LINK"><span
  style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New";
  mso-bidi-font-family:"Courier New";mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'>Case 1: </span></a><span
  style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New";
  mso-bidi-font-family:"Courier New";mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'>AABBBBDAA<o:p></o:p></span></p>
  <p class=MsoNormal><span style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;
  font-family:"Courier New";mso-bidi-font-family:"Courier New";mso-bidi-font-weight:
  bold'>Case 2: AAAAAAAAAAAA<o:p></o:p></span></p>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='layout-grid-mode:char'><span style='font-size:11.0pt;
  mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New";mso-bidi-font-family:
  "Courier New";mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'>Case 3: ABCD<o:p></o:p></span></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
</table>

<div style='mso-element:para-border-div;border:none;border-bottom:double gray 1.0pt;
mso-border-bottom-alt:double gray .75pt;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in'>

<p class=HorizontalLine><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p>

</div>

<p class=MsoNormal style='tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><span
class=SpellE>Problemsetter</span>: <span class=SpellE>Sohel</span> Hafiz</p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'>Special
Thanks to: Mohammad <span class=SpellE>Mahmudur</span> <span class=SpellE>Rahman</span></p>

<body lang=EN-US link="#6633CC" vlink=purple style='tab-interval:.5in'>

<div class=Section1>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><span style='font-size:20.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:24.0pt;font-family:
Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:Arial'>Problem E</span></b><span style='font-family:
Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:Arial'><br>
</span><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style='font-size:20.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:24.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:Arial'>Square </span></b><span
style='font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:Arial'><br>
<b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>Input: </b><span style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
bold'>Standard Input<o:p></o:p></span></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><span style='font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:Arial'>Output: </span></b><span
style='font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'>Standard
Output <o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'>Given <b>n</b> integers you can
generate <b>2<sup>n</sup>-1</b> non-empty subsets from them. Determine for how
many of these subsets the product of all the integers in that is a perfect
square. For example for the set {4<span class=GramE>,6,10,15</span>} there are
3 such subsets. {4}, {6<span class=GramE>,10,15</span>} and {4,6,10,15}. A
perfect square is an integer whose square root is an integer. For example 1, 4,
9, <span class=GramE>16,
. .</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p>

<h5 style='margin-left:0in;text-align:justify;text-indent:0in;tab-stops:0in'><span
class=StyleArial16pt><span style='font-size:16.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>Input<o:p></o:p></span></span></h5>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'>Input contains multiple test
cases. First line of the input contains <span class=GramE><b>T(</b></span><b>1&#8804;T&#8804;30)</b>
the number of test cases. Each test case consists of 2 lines. First line contains
<span class=GramE><b>n(</b></span><b>1&#8804;n&#8804;100)</b> and second line
contains <b>n</b> space separated integers.<span style='mso-spacerun:yes'> 
</span>All these integers are between 1 and 10^15.<span
style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>None of these integers is divisible by a
prime greater than 500.</p>

<p class=MsoNormal><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p>

<h4 style='margin-left:0in;text-indent:0in;tab-stops:0in'><span
class=StyleArial16pt><span style='font-size:16.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>Output <o:p></o:p></span></span></h4>

<p class=MsoNormal><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;tab-stops:143.25pt'>For each test case
output is a single line containing one integer denoting the number of non-empty
subsets whose integer product is a perfect square. The input will be such that
the result will always fit into signed 64 bit integer.</p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;tab-stops:143.25pt'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p>

<h1 align=left style='margin-left:0in;text-align:left;text-indent:0in;
tab-stops:0in'><b><span style='font-size:16.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;
font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:Arial;font-style:normal'>Sample
Input<span style='mso-spacerun:yes'>                        </span><span
style='mso-spacerun:yes'>      </span>Output for Sample Input<o:p></o:p></span></b></h1>

<table class=MsoNormalTable border=0 cellspacing=0 cellpadding=0
 style='margin-left:-.75pt;border-collapse:collapse;mso-padding-alt:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
 <tr style='mso-yfti-irow:0;mso-yfti-firstrow:yes;mso-yfti-lastrow:yes'>
  <td width=313 valign=top style='width:234.9pt;border:solid black 1.0pt;
  border-right:none;mso-border-top-alt:solid black .5pt;mso-border-left-alt:
  solid black .5pt;mso-border-bottom-alt:solid black .5pt;background:#CCCCCC;
  padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='layout-grid-mode:char'><span style='font-size:11.0pt;
  font-family:"Courier New"'>4<o:p></o:p></span></p>
  <p class=MsoNormal><span style='font-size:11.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>3<o:p></o:p></span></p>
  <p class=MsoNormal><span style='font-size:11.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>2
  3 5<o:p></o:p></span></p>
  <p class=MsoNormal><span style='font-size:11.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>3<o:p></o:p></span></p>
  <p class=MsoNormal><span style='font-size:11.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>6
  10 15<o:p></o:p></span></p>
  <p class=MsoNormal><span style='font-size:11.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>4<o:p></o:p></span></p>
  <p class=MsoNormal><span style='font-size:11.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>4
  6 10 15<o:p></o:p></span></p>
  <p class=MsoNormal><span style='font-size:11.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>3<o:p></o:p></span></p>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='layout-grid-mode:char;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric'><span
  style='font-size:11.0pt;font-family:"Courier New";mso-bidi-font-family:"Courier New";
  mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'>2 <span class=SpellE>2</span> <span class=SpellE>2</span><o:p></o:p></span></p>
  </td>
  <td width=338 valign=top style='width:253.5pt;border:solid black 1.0pt;
  mso-border-alt:solid black .5pt;background:#CCCCCC;padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='layout-grid-mode:char'><span style='font-size:11.0pt;
  font-family:"Courier New"'>0<o:p></o:p></span></p>
  <p class=MsoNormal><span style='font-size:11.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>1<o:p></o:p></span></p>
  <p class=MsoNormal><span style='font-size:11.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>3<o:p></o:p></span></p>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='layout-grid-mode:char'><span style='font-size:11.0pt;
  font-family:"Courier New";mso-bidi-font-family:"Courier New"'>3<o:p></o:p></span></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
</table>

<div style='mso-element:para-border-div;border:none;border-bottom:double gray 1.0pt;
mso-border-bottom-alt:double gray .75pt;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in'>

<p class=HorizontalLine><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p>

</div>

<p class=MsoNormal style='tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><span
class=SpellE>Problemsetter</span>: Abdullah al <span class=SpellE>Mahmud</span></p>

	margin-left:0in;
	mso-pagination:widow-orphan;
	page-break-after:avoid;
	mso-hyphenate:none;
	font-size:14.0pt;
	font-family:"Liberation Sans";
	mso-fareast-font-family:"DejaVu LGC Sans";
	mso-bidi-font-family:"DejaVu LGC Sans";
	color:black;
	mso-fareast-language:AR-SA;
	mso-bidi-language:AR-SA;}

	{mso-style-name:Index;
	margin:0in;

	mso-pagination:widow-orphan no-line-numbers;

<!--[if gte mso 10]>
<style>
 /* Style Definitions */
 table.MsoNormalTable
	{mso-style-name:"Table Normal";

	mso-para-margin:0in;
	mso-para-margin-bottom:.0001pt;

	mso-fareast-language:#0400;
	mso-bidi-language:#0400;}
</style>
<![endif]--><!--[if gte mso 9]><xml>
 <o:shapedefaults v:ext="edit" spidmax="3074">
  <o:colormenu v:ext="edit" fillcolor="none [4]" strokecolor="none [1]"
   shadowcolor="none [2]"/>
 </o:shapedefaults></xml><![endif]--><!--[if gte mso 9]><xml>
 <o:shapelayout v:ext="edit">
  <o:idmap v:ext="edit" data="1"/>
 </o:shapelayout></xml><![endif]-->
</head>

<body bgcolor=white lang=EN-US link="#6633CC" vlink=purple style='tab-interval:
.5in'>

<div class=Section1>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><span style='font-size:20.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:24.0pt;font-family:
Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:Arial'>Problem F</span></b><span style='font-family:
Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:Arial'><br>
</span><span style='font-size:20.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:
Arial'>Two Points and Curious <span class=SpellE>MumboJumbo</span></span><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style='font-size:20.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:
24.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:Arial'> </span></b><span
style='font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:Arial'><br>
<b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>Input: </b><span style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
bold'>Standard Input<o:p></o:p></span></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><span style='font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:Arial'>Output: </span></b><span
style='font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'>Standard
Output <o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p>

<p class=MsoNormal>Given two points <span class=GramE><b><i>a</i></b> and</span>
<b><i>b</i></b> on a two dimensional plane, a curious mind can play many
curious games. One such curious game would be to draw two pairs of parallel
lines through these points, the first pair being inclined at and angle of <b><i>&#952;<sub>1</sub></i></b>
and the second pair being inclined at an angle of <b><i>&#952;<sub>2</sub></i></b>
with <span class=SpellE><b><i>ab</i></b></span>, resulting in a parallelogram.
Let the other two points on the parallelogram be <b><i>c</i></b> and <b><i>d</i></b>
such that <b><i>c</i></b> is the one lying on left hand side when looking at <b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>b</i></b>
from <b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>a</i></b>.
So now we have the parallelogram <span class=SpellE><b><i>acbd</i></b></span>
having diagonals <span class=SpellE><b><i>ab</i></b></span> and <span
class=SpellE><b><i>cd</i></b></span>. Now the mathematical mind sees that it
has discovered an interesting way of constructing parallelograms from a pair of
points and decides to name this operation mumbo and happily defines a notation
for this operation <b><i>mumbo(<span class=SpellE>a,b</span>)</i></b>. Note
that the parallelograms produces by <span class=GramE><b><i>mumbo(</i></b></span><span
class=SpellE><b><i>a,b</i></b></span><b><i>)</i></b> and <b><i>mumbo(<span
class=SpellE>b,a</span>)</i></b> for any two points on the plane have same
shape but different orientation.</p>

<p class=MsoNormal><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><!--[if gte vml 1]><v:shapetype id="_x0000_t75" coordsize="21600,21600"
 o:spt="75" o:preferrelative="t" path="m@4@5l@4@11@9@11@9@5xe" filled="f"
 stroked="f">
 <v:stroke joinstyle="miter"/>
 <v:formulas>
  <v:f eqn="if lineDrawn pixelLineWidth 0"/>
  <v:f eqn="sum @0 1 0"/>
  <v:f eqn="sum 0 0 @1"/>
  <v:f eqn="prod @2 1 2"/>
  <v:f eqn="prod @3 21600 pixelWidth"/>
  <v:f eqn="prod @3 21600 pixelHeight"/>
  <v:f eqn="sum @0 0 1"/>
  <v:f eqn="prod @6 1 2"/>
  <v:f eqn="prod @7 21600 pixelWidth"/>
  <v:f eqn="sum @8 21600 0"/>
  <v:f eqn="prod @7 21600 pixelHeight"/>
  <v:f eqn="sum @10 21600 0"/>
 </v:formulas>
 <v:path o:extrusionok="f" gradientshapeok="t" o:connecttype="rect"/>
 <o:lock v:ext="edit" aspectratio="t"/>
</v:shapetype><v:shape id="_x0000_i1025" type="#_x0000_t75" style='width:6in;
 height:290.25pt' filled="t">
 <v:fill color2="black"/>
 <v:imagedata src="http://uva.onlinejudge.org/external/115/f_files/image001.png"  o:title=" />
</v:shape><![endif]--><![if !vml]><img width=576 height=387
src="http://uva.onlinejudge.org/external/115/f_files/image001.png"  v:shapes="_x0000_i1025"><![endif]></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><span
style='mso-spacerun:yes'> </span><br>
To take the game a little farther, the mathematical mind divides the diagonal <span
class=SpellE><b><i>ab</i></b></span> into three equal parts <span class=SpellE><b><i>ae</i></b></span>,
<span class=SpellE><b><i>ef</i></b></span> and <span class=SpellE><b><i>fb</i></b></span>.
Joining <b><i>e</i></b> with <b><i>c</i></b> and <b><i>f</i></b> with <b><i>d</i></b>
produces a strange picture that farther increases the curiosity of the
mathematical mind. To satisfy its curiosity the mind decides to apply the
operation mumbo on these 5 line segment. The result after applying mumbo(<span
class=SpellE>a,e</span>), mumbo(<span class=SpellE>e,f</span>), mumbo(<span
class=SpellE>f,b</span>), mumbo(<span class=SpellE>e,c</span>) and mumbo(<span
class=SpellE>f,d</span>) is an even strange picture showing five smaller
parallelograms inside the initial larger parallelogram. All six of the
parallelograms have similar shape but some has different orientation and they
have same size except for the initial one which in fact contains all the other
parallelograms inside itself. Happily, the mind names this operation of
producing smaller parallelograms of same shape jumbo. The notation for this
operation is <span class=GramE><b><i>jumbo(</i></b></span><span class=SpellE><b><i>a,d,b,c</i></b></span><b><i>)</i></b>
where <span class=SpellE><b><i>a,d,b</i></b></span> and <b><i>c</i></b> are the
vertices of the parallelogram in counter clockwise order.<br>
<br>
The mind takes the game even farther by recursive mumbo jumbo many times,
resulting in a very strange picture consisting of parallelograms of same shape
but different sizes and orientations. Now, to satisfy the ultimate curiosity,
for any two points <b><i>P<sub>1</sub></i></b> and <b><i>P<sub>2</sub></i></b>
on the plane, the mind wants to know the area of the smallest parallelogram not
containing any other parallelogram that contains both of these points. To keep
things simple, mind has decided that <b><i>&#952;<sub>1</sub></i></b> should be
the angle<!--[if mso & !supportInlineShapes & supportFields]><span
style='mso-element:field-begin;mso-field-lock:yes'></span> SHAPE <span
style='mso-spacerun:yes'> </span>\* MERGEFORMAT <span style='mso-element:field-separator'></span><![endif]--><!--[if gte vml 1]><v:group
 id="_x0000_s1026" style='width:17.85pt;height:8.9pt;mso-wrap-distance-left:0;
 mso-wrap-distance-right:0;mso-position-horizontal-relative:char;
 mso-position-vertical-relative:line' coordsize="356,177">
 <v:rect id="_x0000_s1027" style='position:absolute;width:356;height:177;
  v-text-anchor:middle' filled="f" stroked="f">
  <v:stroke joinstyle="round"/>
 </v:rect><v:line id="_x0000_s1028" style='position:absolute;flip:x' from="177,0"
  to="353,177" strokeweight=".26mm">
  <v:stroke joinstyle="miter"/>
 </v:line><v:line id="_x0000_s1029" style='position:absolute' from="179,178"
  to="355,178" strokeweight=".26mm">
  <v:stroke joinstyle="miter"/>
 </v:line><w:wrap type="none"/>
 <w:anchorlock/>
</v:group><![endif]--><![if !vml]><img width=25 height=14
src="http://uva.onlinejudge.org/external/115/f_files/image001.png"  v:shapes="_x0000_s1026 _x0000_s1028 _x0000_s1029"><![endif]><!--[if mso & !supportInlineShapes & supportFields]><v:shape
 id="_x0000_i1026" type="#_x0000_t75" style='width:17.85pt;height:8.9pt'>
 <v:imagedata croptop="-65520f" cropbottom="65520f"/>
</v:shape><span style='mso-element:field-end'></span><![endif]--><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>cab</i></b>
and always be <b><i>tan<sup>-1</sup>(1)</i></b> and <b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><i>&#952;<sub>2</sub></i></b> should be the angle<!--[if mso & !supportInlineShapes & supportFields]><span
style='mso-element:field-begin;mso-field-lock:yes'></span> SHAPE <span
style='mso-spacerun:yes'> </span>\* MERGEFORMAT <span style='mso-element:field-separator'></span><![endif]--><!--[if gte vml 1]><v:group
 id="_x0000_s1030" style='width:17.85pt;height:8.9pt;mso-wrap-distance-left:0;
 mso-wrap-distance-right:0;mso-position-horizontal-relative:char;
 mso-position-vertical-relative:line' coordsize="356,177">
 <v:rect id="_x0000_s1031" style='position:absolute;width:356;height:177;
  v-text-anchor:middle' filled="f" stroked="f">
  <v:stroke joinstyle="round"/>
 </v:rect><v:line id="_x0000_s1032" style='position:absolute;flip:x' from="177,0"
  to="353,177" strokeweight=".26mm">
  <v:stroke joinstyle="miter"/>
 </v:line><v:line id="_x0000_s1033" style='position:absolute' from="179,178"
  to="355,178" strokeweight=".26mm">
  <v:stroke joinstyle="miter"/>
 </v:line><w:wrap type="none"/>
 <w:anchorlock/>
</v:group><![endif]--><![if !vml]><img width=25 height=14
src="http://uva.onlinejudge.org/external/115/f_files/image001.png"  v:shapes="_x0000_s1030 _x0000_s1032 _x0000_s1033"><![endif]><!--[if mso & !supportInlineShapes & supportFields]><v:shape
 id="_x0000_i1027" type="#_x0000_t75" style='width:17.85pt;height:8.9pt'>
 <v:imagedata croptop="-65520f" cropbottom="65520f"/>
</v:shape><span style='mso-element:field-end'></span><![endif]--><span
class=SpellE><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><i style='mso-bidi-font-style:
normal'>abd</i></b></span> and always be <b><i>tan<sup>-1</sup>(½)</i></b>.</p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p>

<h5 style='margin-left:0in;text-align:justify;text-indent:0in;tab-stops:0in'><span
class=StyleArial16pt><span style='font-size:16.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>Input<o:p></o:p></span></span></h5>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'>There will be multiple test cases,
each on a <span class=SpellE>seperate</span> line. Each line will contain eight
floating point numbers <span class=SpellE><b><i>Xa</i></b></span>, <span
class=SpellE><b><i>Ya</i></b></span>, <span class=SpellE><b><i>Xb</i></b></span>,
<span class=SpellE><b><i>Yb</i></b></span>, <b><i>Xp1</i></b>, <b><i>Yp1</i></b>,
<b><i>Xp2</i></b>, <b><i>Yp2</i></b> denoting coordinates of <b><i>a</i></b>,<b><i>b</i></b>,<b><i>p1</i></b>
and <b><i>p2</i></b> <span class=SpellE>respcetively</span>. Here <span
class=GramE><b><i>a</i></b> and</span> <b><i>b</i></b> are the points to start
mumbo jumbo with. You can assume that <b><i>p1</i></b> and <b><i>p2</i></b> will
be distinct and at least <b><i>10<sup>-6</sup></i></b> units apart.</p>

<p class=MsoNormal><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p>

<h4 style='margin-left:0in;text-indent:0in;tab-stops:0in'><span
class=StyleArial16pt><span style='font-size:16.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>Output <o:p></o:p></span></span></h4>

<p class=MsoNormal><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;tab-stops:143.25pt'>For each line
of input, your program should produce a line of output consisting of a single
floating point number having four digits after decimal point denoting the area
of the smallest parallelogram produced by mumbo jumbo which contains both p1
and p2 but does not contain any other parallelogram that contain both of these
points. If either or both of the points are outside of the parallelogram, the
print -1 as output. If a point lies exactly on a vertex of a parallelogram then
the point is considered to be inside the parallelogram.</p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;tab-stops:143.25pt'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p>

<h1 align=left style='margin-left:0in;text-align:left;text-indent:0in;
tab-stops:0in'><b><span style='font-size:16.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;
font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:Arial;font-style:normal'>Sample
Input<span style='mso-spacerun:yes'>                              </span>Output
for Sample Input<o:p></o:p></span></b></h1>

<table class=MsoNormalTable border=0 cellspacing=0 cellpadding=0
 style='margin-left:-1.0pt;border-collapse:collapse;mso-padding-alt:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
 <tr style='mso-yfti-irow:0;mso-yfti-firstrow:yes;mso-yfti-lastrow:yes'>
  <td width=313 valign=top style='width:234.9pt;border:solid black 1.0pt;
  border-right:none;mso-border-top-alt:solid black .5pt;mso-border-left-alt:
  solid black .5pt;mso-border-bottom-alt:solid black .5pt;background:#CCCCCC;
  padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='layout-grid-mode:char'><span style='font-size:11.0pt;
  font-family:"Courier New"'>0 <span class=SpellE>0</span> 81 0 9 1 9 <span
  class=SpellE>9</span><o:p></o:p></span></p>
  <p class=MsoNormal><span style='font-size:11.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>0
  <span class=SpellE>0</span> 81 0 27 0 27 13.5<o:p></o:p></span></p>
  <p class=MsoNormal><span style='font-size:11.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>0
  <span class=SpellE>0</span> 81 0 27 0 27 13.5<o:p></o:p></span></p>
  <p class=MsoNormal><span style='font-size:11.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>0
  <span class=SpellE>0</span> 81 0 <span class=SpellE>0</span> <span
  class=SpellE>0</span> 300 3<o:p></o:p></span></p>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='layout-grid-mode:char;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric'><span
  style='font-size:11.0pt;font-family:"Courier New";mso-bidi-font-family:"Courier New";
  mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'>0 <span class=SpellE>0</span> 81 0 3 0 3 <span
  class=SpellE>3</span><o:p></o:p></span></p>
  </td>
  <td width=339 valign=top style='width:254.0pt;border:solid black 1.0pt;
  mso-border-alt:solid black .5pt;background:#CCCCCC;padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>

  </td>

	mso-hansi-font-family:Symbol;
	mso-bidi-font-family:StarSymbol;}

	{mso-style-name:WW-Absatz-Standardschriftart;
	mso-style-parent:" ;}

	mso-style-parent:" ;}

	mso-style-parent:" ;}

<!--[if gte mso 10]>
<style>
 /* Style Definitions */
 table.MsoNormalTable
	{mso-style-name:"Table Normal";
	mso-tstyle-rowband-size:0;
	mso-tstyle-colband-size:0;
	mso-style-noshow:yes;
	mso-style-parent:" ;
	mso-padding-alt:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt;
	mso-para-margin:0in;
	mso-para-margin-bottom:.0001pt;
	mso-pagination:widow-orphan;

	mso-ansi-language:#0400;
	mso-fareast-language:#0400;
	mso-bidi-language:#0400;}

 <o:shapedefaults v:ext="edit" spidmax="4098"/>
</xml><![endif]--><!--[if gte mso 9]><xml>
 <o:shapelayout v:ext="edit">
  <o:idmap v:ext="edit" data="1"/>
 </o:shapelayout></xml><![endif]-->
</head>

<body lang=EN-US link="#6633CC" vlink=purple style='tab-interval:.5in'>

<div class=Section1>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><span style='font-size:20.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:24.0pt;font-family:
Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:Arial'>Problem G</span></b><span style='font-family:
Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:Arial'><br>
</span><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style='font-size:20.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:24.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:Arial'>Recruiter's
Problem </span></b><span style='font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:Arial'><br>
<b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>Input: </b><span style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
bold'>Standard Input<o:p></o:p></span></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><span style='font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:Arial'>Output: </span></b><span
style='font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'>Standard
Output <o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p>

<p class=MsoNormal>You are working as an HR officer in Nice Computer
Programmer's <span class=GramE>Company(</span>NCPC). You have to hire a lot of
people in a very short period. The hiring process is simple. Interview all the
applicants, grade them, select the ones who survived the interview board, then
assign them to projects. So, you can see, the hardest job is interviewing the
candidates, and find who is capable of working in NCPC. Don't <span
class=GramE>worry,</span> you don't need to do that. You will be given a list
of candidates, who survived the interview, sorted according to their scores
given by the interviewers. You need to <span class=SpellE>to</span> assign them
to different projects. Simple, isn't it? But, unfortunately, this is not as
easy as it seems to be.</p>

<p class=MsoNormal>There are <b><i>N</i></b> candidates and <b><i>M</i></b>
different projects, each project requiring <span class=SpellE><span
class=GramE><b><i>r<sub>i</sub></i></b></span></span> programmers. You know
that, not everyone is interested in working in any position. For example, not
everyone likes the job of tester, or QA Engineer. Every applicant has given you
a list of <span class=GramE>job,</span> they can work, according to their
preferences. Since, NCPC needs to hire a lot of people, they have decided to
recruit maximum number of programmers, <span class=GramE>they</span> can from
current candidates.</p>

<p class=MsoNormal>There can be more than one way to select maximum number of
candidates. That is where their grades and preferences <span class=GramE>comes</span>
into play. If there is more than one way to fill the maximum number of spot,
give the highest ranked candidate his most preferred position you can. If there
is still more than one way, give the second highest ranked candidate, his most
preferred position possible, and so on.</p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><span class=StyleArial16pt><span
style='font-size:16.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>Input<o:p></o:p></span></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p>

<p class=MsoNormal>First line contains <b><i>T (T &#8804; 61)</i></b>, the
number of test cases. Each test case starts with two integer <b><i>N</i></b> (<b>N&lt;=50</b>)
and <b><i>M (M&lt;=50)</i></b>, the number of candidates, and the number of
available projects. The following line contains <b><i>M</i></b> integers <span
class=SpellE><b><i>r<sub>i</sub></i></b></span><b><i><sub> </sub></i></b>(<span
class=SpellE><b><i>r<sub>i</sub></i></b></span><b><i> &#8804; 50<span
class=GramE>, </span></i></b><sub><!--[if gte vml 1]><v:shapetype id="_x0000_t75"
 coordsize="21600,21600" o:spt="75" o:preferrelative="t" path="m@4@5l@4@11@9@11@9@5xe"
 filled="f" stroked="f">
 <v:stroke joinstyle="miter"/>
 <v:formulas>
  <v:f eqn="if lineDrawn pixelLineWidth 0"/>
  <v:f eqn="sum @0 1 0"/>
  <v:f eqn="sum 0 0 @1"/>
  <v:f eqn="prod @2 1 2"/>
  <v:f eqn="prod @3 21600 pixelWidth"/>
  <v:f eqn="prod @3 21600 pixelHeight"/>
  <v:f eqn="sum @0 0 1"/>
  <v:f eqn="prod @6 1 2"/>
  <v:f eqn="prod @7 21600 pixelWidth"/>
  <v:f eqn="sum @8 21600 0"/>
  <v:f eqn="prod @7 21600 pixelHeight"/>
  <v:f eqn="sum @10 21600 0"/>
 </v:formulas>
 <v:path o:extrusionok="f" gradientshapeok="t" o:connecttype="rect"/>
 <o:lock v:ext="edit" aspectratio="t"/>
</v:shapetype><v:shape id="_x0000_i1025" type="#_x0000_t75" style='width:63pt;
 height:16.5pt' o:ole="  filled="t">
 <v:fill color2="black"/>
 <v:imagedata src="http://uva.onlinejudge.org/external/115/g_files/image001.emz"  o:title=" />
</v:shape><![endif]--><![if !vml]><img width=84 height=22
src="http://uva.onlinejudge.org/external/115/g_files/image001.emz"  v:shapes="_x0000_i1025"><![endif]></sub><!--[if gte mso 9]><xml>
 <o:OLEObject Type="Embed" ProgID="opendocument.MathDocument.1"
  ShapeID="_x0000_i1025" DrawAspect="Content" ObjectID="_1286354572">
 </o:OLEObject>
</xml><![endif]--><b><i>),</i></b> the number of open spots in project <span
class=SpellE><b><i>i</i></b></span>. The next <b><i>N</i></b> lines describe
the preferences of candidate <span class=SpellE><b><i>i</i></b></span>. Each of
the lines starts with an integer <b><i>K (K &#8804; M)</i></b>, followed by <b><i>K</i></b>
integer <span class=SpellE><b><i>p<sub>j</sub></i></b></span> <b><i>(j = 1...K)</i></b>,
the projects <span class=SpellE>i-th</span> applicant is interested to work,
sorted by his/her preference (<b><i>p<sub>1</sub></i></b> is the most preferred
project, and <span class=SpellE><b><i>p<sub>K</sub></i></b></span> is the least
preferred). Applicant <span class=GramE>1,</span> is the highest ranked
applicant, and applicant <b><i>N</i></b> is the least ranked. <span
class=GramE>for</span> all candidates, <span class=SpellE><b>p<sub>j</sub></b></span><b>
&lt;= M</b>, and no job appear in the list twice</p>

<p class=MsoNormal><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p>

<h4 style='margin-left:0in;text-indent:0in;tab-stops:0in'><span
class=StyleArial16pt><span style='font-size:16.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>Output <o:p></o:p></span></span></h4>

<p class=MsoNormal><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;tab-stops:143.25pt'>For each test
case output the case number, followed by the maximum number of applicant you
can recruit, <b><i>L</i></b>. This is followed by <b><i>L</i></b> lines, each
containing two integers, <span class=GramE><b><i>a</i></b> and</span> <b><i>p</i></b>,
where <span class=SpellE><b><i>a<sup>th</sup></i></b></span> applicant is
recruited for project <b><i>p</i></b>.</p>

<h3 style='mso-list:none;tab-stops:.5in'><span style='font-size:16.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:13.5pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:Arial'>Sample
Input<span style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span><span
style='mso-spacerun:yes'>                            </span>Output for Sample
Input<o:p></o:p></span></h3>

<table class=MsoNormalTable border=0 cellspacing=0 cellpadding=0
 style='margin-left:-1.5pt;border-collapse:collapse;mso-padding-alt:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
 <tr style='mso-yfti-irow:0;mso-yfti-firstrow:yes;mso-yfti-lastrow:yes'>
  <td width=313 valign=top style='width:234.9pt;border:solid black 1.0pt;
  border-right:none;mso-border-top-alt:solid black .5pt;mso-border-left-alt:
  solid black .5pt;mso-border-bottom-alt:solid black .5pt;background:#CCCCCC;
  padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
  <p class=TableContents style='layout-grid-mode:char'><span style='font-size:
  11.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>1 <o:p></o:p></span></p>
  <p class=TableContents><span style='font-size:11.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>3
  <span class=SpellE>3</span> <o:p></o:p></span></p>
  <p class=TableContents><span style='font-size:11.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>1
  <span class=SpellE>1</span> <span class=SpellE>1</span> <o:p></o:p></span></p>
  <p class=TableContents><span style='font-size:11.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>2
  1 2 <o:p></o:p></span></p>
  <p class=TableContents><span style='font-size:11.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>2
  3 2 <o:p></o:p></span></p>
  <p class=TableContents style='layout-grid-mode:char;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric'><span
  style='font-size:11.0pt;font-family:"Courier New";mso-bidi-font-family:"Courier New";
  mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'>2 3 2<o:p></o:p></span></p>
  </td>
  <td width=340 valign=top style='width:255.0pt;border:solid black 1.0pt;
  mso-border-alt:solid black .5pt;background:#CCCCCC;padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
  <p class=TableContents style='layout-grid-mode:char'><span style='font-size:
  11.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>Case #1: <o:p></o:p></span></p>
  <p class=TableContents><span style='font-size:11.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>3
  applicant(s) can be hired. <o:p></o:p></span></p>
  <p class=TableContents><span style='font-size:11.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>1
  <span class=SpellE>1</span> <o:p></o:p></span></p>
  <p class=TableContents><span style='font-size:11.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>2
  3 <o:p></o:p></span></p>
  <p class=TableContents style='layout-grid-mode:char'><span style='font-size:
  11.0pt;font-family:"Courier New";mso-bidi-font-family:"Courier New"'>3 2 <o:p></o:p></span></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
</table>

<div style='mso-element:para-border-div;border:none;border-bottom:double gray 1.0pt;
mso-border-bottom-alt:double gray .75pt;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in'>

	{mso-style-next:Normal;

	mso-font-kerning:0pt;

<!--[if gte mso 10]>
<style>
 /* Style Definitions */
 table.MsoNormalTable
	{mso-style-name:"Table Normal";
	mso-tstyle-rowband-size:0;
	mso-tstyle-colband-size:0;
	mso-style-noshow:yes;
	mso-style-parent:" ;
	mso-padding-alt:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt;
	mso-para-margin:0in;
	mso-para-margin-bottom:.0001pt;
	mso-pagination:widow-orphan;
	font-size:10.0pt;
	font-family:"Times New Roman";
	mso-ansi-language:#0400;
	mso-fareast-language:#0400;
	mso-bidi-language:#0400;}
</style>
<![endif]--><!--[if gte mso 9]><xml>
 <o:shapedefaults v:ext="edit" spidmax="4098"/>
</xml><![endif]--><!--[if gte mso 9]><xml>
 <o:shapelayout v:ext="edit">
  <o:idmap v:ext="edit" data="1"/>
 </o:shapelayout></xml><![endif]-->
</head>

<body lang=EN-US link="#6633CC" vlink=purple style='tab-interval:.5in'>

<div class=Section1>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><span style='font-size:20.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:24.0pt;font-family:
Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:Arial'>Problem H</span></b><span style='font-family:
Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:Arial'><br>
</span><b><span style='font-size:20.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:
Arial'>Avoiding Jungle in the Dark</span></b><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><span style='font-size:20.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:24.0pt;font-family:
Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:Arial'> </span></b><span style='font-family:Arial;
mso-bidi-font-family:Arial'><br>
<b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>Input: </b><span style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
bold'>Standard Input<o:p></o:p></span></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><span style='font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:Arial'>Output: </span></b><span
style='font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'>Standard
Output <o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'>A Pilgrim is all set for a long
journey to the <st1:place w:st="on">Holy land</st1:place>. The journey is long and
involves covering dangerous grounds. In particular, he needs to go through two
types of <i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>land</i>, plain and jungles. It
is safe to be located on a plain ground during any hour of the day, but
traveling into or staying in the jungle must be avoided during dark hours.
Also, the Pilgrim is a human so he must take rests. He can not travel
continuously for more than 16 hours; he will need a rest after that. However,
he can decide to have a rest anytime he wants, even after getting up from one
rest session. Once he decides to take a rest, he must do so for exactly 8
hours. </p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'>Given the map of the route, help
the Pilgrim to determine the minimum time that would be required to travel from
the starting position to the destination. </p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p>

<h5 style='margin-left:0in;text-align:justify;text-indent:0in;tab-stops:0in'><span
class=StyleArial16pt><span style='font-size:16.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>Input<o:p></o:p></span></span></h5>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'>The first line of input contains
a positive integer <b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>T&lt;=100. </b>Each
of the next <b>T</b><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'> </b>lines contains
a string of length at least 2 and at most 1000. The string will always begin
with an S and end with a D. The characters in between will be either a <b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>.</b> Or <b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'>*</b>, quotes for clarity.<span style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>Here
a . represents a plain land and * a jungle. It takes exactly one hour to
travel from one position to the next and the Pilgrim never travels backward.
Note that he is always located at the left most position of a particular <i
style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>land</i> and when he travels to the next <i
style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>land</i>, he travels for a full hour to the
reach the left most position of the next <i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>land</i>.<span
style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p>

<h4 style='margin-left:0in;text-indent:0in;tab-stops:0in'><span
class=StyleArial16pt><span style='font-size:16.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>Output <o:p></o:p></span></span></h4>

<p class=MsoNormal><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;tab-stops:143.25pt'>For each case
of input there will be one line of output. It will first contain the case
number followed by the minimum time required to reach the destination. In case
it is not possible to reach the destination, output -1. Note that he starts his
journey from the position marked S and finishes at D. On the first day of his
journey, he is located on S at 6 AM. Dark hours are considered to be the time
between 6 PM to 6 AM inclusive.</p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;tab-stops:143.25pt'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p>

<h1 align=left style='margin-left:0in;text-align:left;text-indent:0in;
tab-stops:0in'><b><span style='font-size:16.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;
font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:Arial;font-style:normal'>Sample
Input<span style='mso-spacerun:yes'>                              </span>Output
for Sample Input<o:p></o:p></span></b></h1>

<table class=MsoNormalTable border=0 cellspacing=0 cellpadding=0
 style='margin-left:-.75pt;border-collapse:collapse;mso-padding-alt:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
 <tr style='mso-yfti-irow:0;mso-yfti-firstrow:yes;mso-yfti-lastrow:yes'>
  <td width=313 valign=top style='width:234.9pt;border:solid black 1.0pt;
  border-right:none;mso-border-top-alt:solid black .5pt;mso-border-left-alt:
  solid black .5pt;mso-border-bottom-alt:solid black .5pt;background:#CCCCCC;
  padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='layout-grid-mode:char'>3</p>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='text-autospace:ideograph-numeric'><span
  style='font-family:"Courier New";mso-bidi-font-family:"Courier New"'>S.......D<o:p></o:p></span></p>
  <p class=MsoNormal><span style='font-family:"Courier New";mso-bidi-font-family:
  "Courier New"'>S...****................***.D<o:p></o:p></span></p>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='layout-grid-mode:char;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric'><span
  style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;font-family:"Courier New";
  mso-bidi-font-family:"Courier New";mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'>S***********.***********D<o:p></o:p></span></p>
  </td>
  <td width=338 valign=top style='width:253.5pt;border:solid black 1.0pt;
  mso-border-alt:solid black .5pt;background:#CCCCCC;padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='layout-grid-mode:char'><span style='font-family:
  "Courier New";mso-bidi-font-family:"Courier New"'>Case #1: 8<o:p></o:p></span></p>
  <p class=MsoNormal><span style='font-family:"Courier New";mso-bidi-font-family:
  "Courier New"'>Case #2: 36<o:p></o:p></span></p>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='layout-grid-mode:char'><span style='font-size:11.0pt;
  mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New";mso-bidi-font-family:
  "Courier New"'>Case #3: -1<o:p></o:p></span></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
</table>

mso-border-bottom-alt:double gray .75pt;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in'>

</div>

Shamim Hafiz</p>

	mso-level-text:" ;
	mso-level-tab-stop:0in;
	mso-level-number-position:left;
	margin-left:0in;
	text-indent:0in;}

	{mso-level-number-format:none;
	mso-level-suffix:none;
	mso-level-text:" ;

	margin-left:0in;

<!--[if gte mso 10]>
<style>
 /* Style Definitions */

	{mso-style-name:"Table Normal";
	mso-tstyle-rowband-size:0;
	mso-tstyle-colband-size:0;
	mso-style-noshow:yes;
	mso-style-parent:" ;
	mso-padding-alt:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt;
	mso-para-margin:0in;
	mso-para-margin-bottom:.0001pt;
	mso-pagination:widow-orphan;
	font-size:10.0pt;

	mso-ansi-language:#0400;
	mso-fareast-language:#0400;
	mso-bidi-language:#0400;}

 <o:shapelayout v:ext="edit">
  <o:idmap v:ext="edit" data="1"/>
 </o:shapelayout></xml><![endif]-->
</head>

<body lang=EN-US link="#6633CC" vlink=purple style='tab-interval:.5in'>

<div class=Section1>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><span style='font-size:20.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:24.0pt;font-family:
Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:Arial'>Problem I</span></b><span style='font-family:
Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:Arial'><br>
</span><b><span style='font-size:20.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:
Arial'>Olympic Swimming</span></b><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span
style='font-size:20.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:24.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:
Arial'> </span></b><span style='font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:Arial'><br>
<b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>Input: </b><span style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
bold'>Standard Input<o:p></o:p></span></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><span style='font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:Arial'>Output: </span></b><span
style='font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'>Standard
Output <o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><span class=GramE>Hurdles is</span>
a common event in athletics where the runners race in running tracks containing
hurdles (obstacles). For the race some hurdles are placed evenly spaced along a
straight running course. They are positioned so that they will fall over if
bumped into by the runner. </p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'>The organizers of 20012 Olympic <span
class=GramE>games</span> are planning to introduce a hurdles event in swimming.
For this purpose, some hurdles will be placed in the swimming pool used in the
competition. Let's describe the construction of a swimming pool at first. A
pool is <b>L </b>meters long &amp; is divided into <b>K </b>equal size lanes
across the width. Each participant swims along his own lane. As events of
various <span class=GramE>length</span> take place in the same pool,
measurement of length is very critical. So, there is a mark after every meter
along the length of the pool starting from 0 in one end. As it is said earlier,
there are some hurdles placed in the pool. There is at most one hurdle in a
lane between two adjacent length marks. Again, a hurdle will always be between
two adjacent marks. Now, the hurdles are not uniformly distributed. For
example, in a 5 meter long pool with 2 lanes, the first lane may have 2
hurdles, one between 1m &amp; 2m while another between 3m &amp; 4m. The second
lane may have 1 hurdle, between 0m &amp; 1m. For ensuring a fair race, the
course must be defined in a way so that all the participants have <span
class=GramE>to<span style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>face</span> same number
of hurdles. In other words, you are to select two length marks from the pool so
that there <span class=GramE>are same number</span> of hurdles placed in every
lane between these two length marks. You can safely assume that, a race course
will always start in a length mark. </p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p>

<h5 style='margin-left:0in;text-align:justify;text-indent:0in;tab-stops:0in'><span
class=StyleArial16pt><span style='font-size:16.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>Input<o:p></o:p></span></span></h5>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'>There <span class=GramE>is</span>
at most 60 test cases. The first line of every test case contains two integers,
<b>L (0&lt;L&lt;=50000) </b>&amp; <b>K (1&lt;=K&lt;=30)</b>.<span
style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>Each of the next <b>K</b><span
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'> lines describes a lane. Each of these lines
starts with an integer <b>n (0&lt;=n&lt;=5000)</b>, the number of hurdles in
that lane. Then follows <b>n </b>integers <b>p<sub>i</sub> (1&lt;=<span
class=SpellE>i</span>&lt;=n &amp;&amp; 0&lt;=p<sub>i</sub>&lt;L). </b>Each
integer <b>p<sub>i</sub> </b>means there is a hurdle between length mark <b>p<sub>i</sub>
</b>&amp; <span class=GramE><b>p<sub>i<span style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span></sub>+</b></span><b>
1.<o:p></o:p></b></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'>The input is terminated with a
case where L = K = 0.</p>

<p class=MsoNormal><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p>

<h4 style='margin-left:0in;text-indent:0in;tab-stops:0in'><span
class=StyleArial16pt><span style='font-size:16.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>Output <o:p></o:p></span></span></h4>

<p class=MsoNormal><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;tab-stops:143.25pt'>For each test
case, print a single line containing <b>Case #X: Y meter(s)</b> where <b>X</b>
is the case <span class=GramE>number<span style='mso-spacerun:yes'> 
</span>&amp;</span> <b>Y</b> is the longest race that can take place in that
pool. The first test case is the one mentioned above. </p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;tab-stops:143.25pt'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p>

<h1 align=left style='margin-left:0in;text-align:left;text-indent:0in;
tab-stops:0in'><b><span style='font-size:16.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;
font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:Arial;font-style:normal'>Sample
Input<span style='mso-spacerun:yes'>                              </span>Output
for Sample Input<o:p></o:p></span></b></h1>

<table class=MsoNormalTable border=0 cellspacing=0 cellpadding=0
 style='margin-left:-1.25pt;border-collapse:collapse;mso-padding-alt:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
 <tr style='mso-yfti-irow:0;mso-yfti-firstrow:yes;mso-yfti-lastrow:yes'>
  <td width=313 valign=top style='width:234.9pt;border:solid black 1.0pt;
  border-right:none;mso-border-top-alt:solid black .5pt;mso-border-left-alt:
  solid black .5pt;mso-border-bottom-alt:solid black .5pt;background:#CCCCCC;
  padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='layout-grid-mode:char;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric'><a

  <p class=MsoNormal style='layout-grid-mode:char;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric'><span

  <p class=MsoNormal style='layout-grid-mode:char;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric'><span

  <p class=MsoNormal style='layout-grid-mode:char;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric'><span

  <p class=MsoNormal style='layout-grid-mode:char;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric'><span

  <p class=MsoNormal style='layout-grid-mode:char;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric'><span

  <p class=MsoNormal style='layout-grid-mode:char;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric'><span

  style='mso-bookmark:DDE_LINK1'><span style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:

  <p class=MsoNormal style='layout-grid-mode:char;text-autospace:ideograph-numeric'><span

<BODY bgcolor=white text=black link=blue vlink=purple alink=fushia >
<P 
 align="center"
><FONT size="+2" color="#000000"></B>Problem A </P
><DIV class="Part" 

><H1 
 align="center"
><FONT size="+3" color="#258234">AUTOMATIC ANSWER<BR></H1
><P 
 align="center"
><FONT size="+1" color="#000000"></P
><P 

><FONT size="+1">Last month Alice nonchalantly entered her name in a draw for a Tapmaster 4000. Upon checking her mail today, she found a letter that read: </P
><P 

>&ldquo;Congratulations, Alice! You have won a Tapmaster 4000. To claim your prize, you must answer the following skill testing question.&rdquo; </P
><P 

>Alice&rsquo;s initial feelings of surprised joy turned quickly to those of dismay. Her lifetime record for skill testing questions is an abysmal 3 right and 42 wrong. </P
><P 

>Mad Skills, the leading skill testing question development company, was hired to provide skill testing questions for this particular Tapmaster 4000 draw. They decided to create a different skill testing question to each winner so that the winners could not collaborate to answer the question. </P
><P 

>Can you help Alice win the Tapmaster 4000 by solving the skill testing question? </P
><P 

><FONT size="+2" color="#258234">Program Input </P
><P 

><FONT size="+1" color="#000000">The input begins with <I>t </I>(1 &le; <I>t </I>&le; 100), the number of test cases. Each test case contains an integer <I>n </I>(-1000 &le; <I>n </I>&le; 1000) on a line by itself. This <I>n</I> should be substituted into the skill testing question below. </P
><P 

><FONT size="+2" color="#258234">Program Output </P
><P 

><FONT size="+1" color="#000000">For each test case, output the answer to the following skill testing question on a line by itself: &ldquo;Multiply <I>n</I> by 567, then divide the result by 9, then add 7492, then multiply by 235, then divide by 47, then subtract 498. What is the digit in the tens column?&rdquo; </P
><P 

><FONT size="+2" color="#258234">Sample Input &amp; Output </P
><P 

><FONT size="+1" color="#000000">I<FONT size="+1">NPUT
<pre>
2
637
-120
</pre>

<FONT size="+1">O<FONT size="+1">UTPUT
<pre>
1
3
</pre>
<hr>
<FONT size="+1"><I>Calgary Collegiate Programming Contest 2008</I>	<BR> </P
></DIV
></BODY>
</HTML>

______________________________________________________
11548||||||false||||||
<!DOCTYPE HTML PUBLIC "-//W3C//DTD HTML 3.2 Final//EN">
<!-- Created from PDF via Acrobat SaveAsXML -->
<!-- Mapping table version: 28-February-2003 -->
<HTML>
<HEAD>
<META
 name="dc.creator"
 content="Sean McIntyre" >
<META
 name="dc.title"
 content="CCPC2008" >
<META
 name="dc.date"
 content="2008-09-18T01:37:49-06:00" >
<META
 name="dc.date.modified"
 content="2008-09-18T01:43:09-06:00" >
<META
 name="generator"
 content="Adobe Acrobat Exchange-Pro 7.256" >
</HEAD>
<BODY bgcolor=white text=black link=blue vlink=purple alink=fushia >
<P 
 align="center"
><FONT size="+2" color="#000000"></B>Problem B </P
><DIV class="Part" 

><H1 
 align="center"
><FONT size="+3" color="#258234">BLACKBOARD BONANZA<BR></H1
><P 
 align="center"
><FONT size="+1" color="#000000"></P
><P 

><FONT size="+1">Alice and Bob both have lots of candies but want more. They decide to play the following turn-based game. </P
><P 

>First they write some words on a few pieces of paper and put them into a bag so they cannot see the words. Next they decide whose turn is first. The first turn begins with the first player drawing and keeping a piece of paper with the word <I>A</I> from the bag and copying <I>A </I>onto a blackboard evenly spaced. </P
><P 

>Then the second player draws and keeps a piece of paper with the word <I>B</I> on it. The current player is to write <I>B</I> on the blackboard underneath <I>A </I>evenly spaced. The second player receives one candy from the first for each character that matches vertically between <I>A</I> and <I>B</I>. </P
><P 

>Now it is the first player&rsquo;s turn who similarly draws and places word <I>C</I> underneath <I>B</I> and gains a candy for each of the characters vertically matched between <I>B</I> and <I>C</I>. The game continues until there are no more words in the bag. </P
><P 

>What is the maximum number of candies that one of Alice and Bob can possibly get in a turn? </P
><div align="center"><IMG src="http://uva.onlinejudge.org/external/115/p11548.png"  ><p><I>The game on the second blackboard awards the second player one candy. The game on the third blackboard awards the second player two candies. </I></div></P
><DIV class="Sect" 

><H2 

><FONT size="+2" color="#258234">Program Input </H2
><P 

><FONT size="+1" color="#000000">The first line of the input contains an integer <I>t </I>(1 &le; <I>t </I>&le; 70), the number of test cases. Each test case starts with an integer <I>n </I>(2 &le; <I>n </I>&le; 70), the number of words in the bag. Then follow <I>n</I> lines containing one word each (in no particular order). Each word will contain between 1 and 70 characters, all of them uppercase letters of English alphabet. </P
><P 

></DIV
><DIV class="Sect" 

><H2 
 align="justify"
><FONT size="+2" color="#258234">Program Output </H2
><P 
 align="justify"
><FONT size="+1" color="#000000">For each test case, print a line containing the maximum number of candies either Alice or Bob can get in a single turn. </P
></DIV
><DIV class="Sect" 

><H2 
 align="justify"
><FONT size="+2" color="#258234">Sample Input &amp; Output </H2
><P 
 align="justify"
><FONT size="+1" color="#000000">I<FONT size="+1">NPUT
<pre>
2
2
ALICE
BOB
2
ABCB
BCAB
</pre>

<FONT size="+1">O<FONT size="+1">UTPUT
<pre>
0
2
</pre>
<hr>
<FONT size="+1"><I>Calgary Collegiate Programming Contest 2008</I>	<BR> </P
></DIV
></DIV
></BODY>
</HTML>

______________________________________________________

<HEAD>
<META
 name="dc.creator"

<META
 name="dc.title"
 content="CCPC2008" >
<META
 name="dc.date"
 content="2008-09-18T19:24:59-04:00" >
<META
 name="dc.date.modified"
 content="2008-09-18T19:24:59-04:00" >
<META
 name="generator"
 content="Adobe Acrobat Exchange-Pro 7.256" >
</HEAD>
<BODY bgcolor=white text=black link=blue vlink=purple alink=fushia >
<P 
 align="center"
><FONT size="+2" color="#000000"></B>Problem C </P
><DIV class="Part" 

><H1 
 align="center"
><FONT size="+3" color="#258234">CALCULATOR CONUNDRUM<BR></H1
><P 
 align="center"
><FONT size="+1" color="#000000"></P
><P 

><FONT size="+1">Alice got a hold of an old calculator that can display <I>n</I> digits. She was bored enough to come up with the following time waster. </P
><P 

>She enters a number <I>k</I> then repeatedly squares it until the result overflows. When the result overflows, only the <I>n </I><FONT color="#FF2600">most<FONT color="#000000"> significant digits are displayed on the screen and an error flag appears. Alice can clear the error and continue squaring the displayed number. She got bored by this soon enough, but wondered: </P
><P 

>&ldquo;Given <I>n</I> and <I>k</I>, what is the largest number I can get by wasting time in this manner?&rdquo; </P
><P 

><FONT size="+2" color="#258234">Program Input </P
><P 

><FONT size="+1" color="#000000">The first line of the input contains an integer <I>t </I>(1 &le; <I>t </I>&le; 200), the number of test cases. Each test case contains two integers <I>n </I>(1 &le; <I>n </I>&le; 9) and <I>k </I>(0 &le; <I>k </I>&lt; 10<Sup><I>n</I></Sup>) where <I>n</I> is the number of digits this calculator can display <I>k </I>is the starting number. </P
><P 

><FONT size="+2" color="#258234">Program Output </P
><P 

><FONT size="+1" color="#000000">For each test case, print the maximum number that Alice can get by repeatedly squaring the starting number as described. </P
><P 

><FONT size="+2" color="#258234">Sample Input &amp; Output </P
><P 

><FONT size="+1" color="#000000">I<FONT size="+1">NPUT
<pre>
2
1 6
2 99
</pre>

<FONT size="+1">O<FONT size="+1">UTPUT
<pre>
9
99
</pre>
<hr>
<FONT size="+1"><I>Calgary Collegiate Programming Contest 2008</I>	<BR> </P
></DIV
></BODY>
</HTML>

______________________________________________________

<HEAD>

<META

<BODY bgcolor=white text=black link=blue vlink=purple alink=fushia >
<P 
 align="center"
><FONT size="+2" color="#000000"></B>Problem D </P
><DIV class="Part" 

><H1 
 align="center"
><FONT size="+3" color="#258234">DEMANDING DILEMMA<BR></H1
><P 
 align="center"
><FONT size="+1" color="#000000"> </P
><P 

><FONT size="+1">A simple undirected graph is an ordered pair <I>G</I> = (<I>V</I>, <I>E</I>) where <I>V</I> is a non-empty set of vertices, and <I>E</I> is a set of unordered pairs (<I>u</I>, <I>v</I>) where <I>u </I>and <I>v </I>are in <I>V </I>and <I>u </I>&ne; <I>v</I>. If <I>S </I>is a set, define |<I>S</I>| as the size of <I>S</I>. An incidence matrix <I>M</I> is a |<I>V</I>| x |<I>E</I>| matrix where <I>M</I>(<I>i</I>, <I>j</I>) is 1 if edge <I>j </I>is incident to vertex <I>i </I>(edge <I>j </I>is either (<I>i</I>, <I>u</I>) or (<I>u</I>, <I>i</I>)) and 0 otherwise. </P
><P 

>Given an <I>n </I>x <I>m</I> matrix, can it be an incidence matrix of a simple undirected graph <I>G = </I>(<I>V</I>, <I>E</I>) where |<I>V</I>| = <I>n</I> and |<I>E</I>| = <I>m</I>? </P
><P 

><FONT size="+2" color="#258234">Program Input </P
><P 

><FONT size="+1" color="#000000">The first line of the input contains an integer <I>t </I>(1 &le; <I>t </I>&le; 41), the number of test cases. </P
><P 

>Each test case starts with a line with two integers <I>n </I>(1 &le; <I>n </I>&le; 8) and <I>m </I>(0 &le; <I>m </I>&le; <I>n</I>(<I>n</I>-1)/2). Then <I>n </I>lines containing <I>m</I> integers (0&rsquo;s or 1&rsquo;s) each follow such that the <I>j</I>th number on the <I>i</I>th line is <I>M</I>(<I>i</I>, <I>j</I>). </P
><P 

><FONT size="+2" color="#258234">Program Output </P
><P 

><FONT size="+1" color="#000000">For each test case print &ldquo;Yes&rdquo; if the incidence matrix given in the input can be an incidence matrix of some simple undirected graph, otherwise print &ldquo;No&rdquo;. </P
><P 

><FONT size="+2" color="#258234">Sample Input &amp; Output </P
><P 

><FONT size="+1" color="#000000">I<FONT size="+1">NPUT
<pre>
3
3 3
1 1 0
0 1 1
1 0 1
3 1
1
1
0
3 3
1 1 0
1 1 1
1 0 0
</pre>

<FONT size="+1">O<FONT size="+1">UTPUT
<pre>
Yes
Yes
No
</pre>
<hr>
<FONT size="+1"><I>Calgary Collegiate Programming Contest 2008</I>	<BR> </P
></DIV
></BODY>
</HTML>

<HEAD>
<META

<P 
 align="center"
><FONT size="+2" color="#000000"></B>Problem E </P
><DIV class="Part" 

><H1 
 align="center"
><FONT size="+3" color="#258234">EXPERIENCED ENDEAVOUR<BR></H1
><P 
 align="center"
><FONT size="+1" color="#000000"></P
><P 

><FONT size="+1">Alice is given a list of integers by Bob and is asked to generate a new list where each element in the new list is the sum of some other integers in the original list. The task is slightly more involved, as Bob also asks Alice to repeat this several times before giving him the result. Help Alice automate her task. </P
><P 

><FONT size="+2" color="#258234">Program Input </P
><P 

><FONT size="+1" color="#000000">The first line of the input is <I>t </I>(1 &le; <I>t </I>&le; 10), the number of cases to follow.  Each case is in the following format: </P
><IMG width="289" height="144"
 src="http://uva.onlinejudge.org/external/115/p11551a.png"  ><P 

>Each case begins with the integer <I>n </I>(1 &le; <I>n </I>&le; 50), which is the number of elements in the list of integers that Alice is given. The integer <I>r </I>(1 &le; <I>r </I>&le; 10<Sup>9</Sup>) is the number of times these operations are to be repeated on a list before returning the result. The values are the nonnegative integers in the original list. Then <I>n</I> lines follow that define how Alice will generate a new list from a previous one. Each of these lines are in the form: </P
><IMG width="177" height="16"
 src="http://uva.onlinejudge.org/external/115/p11551a.png"  ><P 
>This line defines the value of the <I>i</I>th element in the new list to be the sum of elements: </P
><IMG width="199" height="15"
 src="http://uva.onlinejudge.org/external/115/p11551a.png"  ><P 
><FONT size="+2" color="#258234">Program Output </P
><P 
><FONT size="+1" color="#000000">The output consists of <I>t</I> lines, one line for each test case listing the final list of integers modulo 1000 in the form: </P
><P 
><I>c<sub>0</sub>&nbsp;&nbsp;c<sub>1</sub> . . . c<sub>n-1<sub></I><BR> </P
><P 
><P 
><FONT size="+2" color="#258234">Sample Input &amp; Output </P
><P 
><FONT size="+1" color="#000000">I<FONT size="+1">NPUT
<pre>
2
2 2
1 2
2 0 1
1 1
2 4
507 692
2 0 1
1 1
</pre>

<FONT size="+1">O<FONT size="+1">UTPUT
<pre>
5 2
275 692
</pre>
<hr>
<FONT size="+1"><I>Calgary Collegiate Programming Contest 2008</I>	<BR> </P
></DIV
></BODY>
</HTML>
